title: sendai_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sendai[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: an [[orange shirt]] with [[white sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels on her ankles, 14 cm gun mounts on both of her elbow gloves (with an additional [[aircraft catapult]] on her right), and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her [[black belt]]. 

She seems obsessed with night battles, on account of her historical battle record. Her obsession is so strong that she is also known as the "[[Night Battle Idiot]]" in-game. The phrase "night battle" is often used as a [[euphemism]] for [[sex]] in KanColle fan works. Her name can also be read as "Kawauchi", which is sometimes used to refer to her in a teasing way.

h4. Appearance

title: take_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Take[/i]. Character design by [[Watanabe Akio]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]] cut into an [[inverted bob]] with [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked_hair|streaks]], [[antenna hair]], and [[orange eyes]]. Her default outfit, the [i]Matsu[/i]-class uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar]], [[green neckerchief]], [[black corset]] (with an [[anchor]] [[zipper pull tab]]), [[short_shorts|very short]] [[grey_shorts|gray]] [[cutoffs]] held by a wide [[black belt]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black gloves]], a [[single knee pad]] over her left knee, and a red [[turtleneck]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast (with [[radar]]) to her back, 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the rig, a 12.7 cm single [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right leg, and [[depth charge]]s on her left leg.

title: kamikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Kamikaze[/i], lead ship of the [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class destroyers. Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], reddish-[[purple hair]] which [[gradient_hair| gradually fades]] to [[pink hair|pink]] at the ends, tied with a [[yellow ribbon]]. 

Kamikaze and her sisters wear traditional [[Japanese clothes]], namely a [[pink hakama]] over a [[red kimono]] paired with [[lace-up boots]] in the style of a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]], in reference to how she and her sisters were built during the [[Taishou]] era (when this style of dress was still common).

She doesn't want to be seen as old, despite being of the oldest destroyer class in the game and her old-fashioned looks. That being said, she has an excellent war record for her capabilities.

Kamikaze is related in some way to all four of the [i]Myoukou[/i]-class:

* She was part of Destroyer Division 1, which was part of the 5th fleet, led by [[nachi (kancolle)|Nachi]] during the battle of Attu.
* She was under the command of [[haguro (kancolle)|Haguro]] (and protected by her) during the Battle of Malacca Strait. Kamikaze saved some of Haguro's survivors after the battle.
* She was under [[Ashigara (kancolle)|Ashigara]]'s command until her sinking and also saved some of her survivors.
* She surrendered along with the crippled [[myoukou (kancolle)|Myoukou]] (and Takao) at Singapore.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has no relation to the [[kamikaze pilot]]s who conducted suicide attacks on Allied ships later in World War II.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24837315: Base
* !asset #24837316: [[Kamikaze (Valentine) (Kancolle)|Valentine]]

title: kiyoshimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kiyoshimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] outer, [[blue hair|blue]] inner) with a [[single hair bun]] turning into [[low twintails]], an [[ahoge]], a strand of hair passing [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]; and [[grey eyes]]. 

She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a purple/maroon [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]], [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] and [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

h4. Skins

* !post #2441828: Base and kai
* !post #6765936: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] - Anti-air
* !post #6765937: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] - Anti-submarine
* !post #7777368: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (with parka)
* !post #7914298: [[Kiyoshimo Kai Ni (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (without parka)
* !post #2248962: Setsubun mode
* !post #3917070: Tsuyu mode
* !post #6399017: Casual

h4. Personality
An excitable girl, she wants to become a battleship due to her admiration of the battleship [[musashi (kancolle)|Musashi]]. So, it is not uncommon to draw her with Musashi's (or another battleship's) rigging, if only to collapse under the weight.

h4. External links

title: kiyoshimo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Kiyoshimo (Kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a variant of the class' kai-ni uniform: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[grey jacket|grey]] [[collared jacket]] over the usual [[purple dress]], [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[high heels|high-heel]] [[lace-up boots]], but now sports black [[partially fingerless gloves]] and [[grey thighhighs]] instead of pantyhose. 

Her [[rigging]] remains identical, differing only in that instead of two quad [[torpedo tubes]], she now only has one: the other is replaced with [[depth charge]]s. She also gains an additional 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] (or depth charges in ASW form) on her left collar.

title: kinugasa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the second of the two ships of the [i]Aoba[/i]-class cruisers.

She has [[grey_hair|grey]]-[[pink hair]] tied up in [[short twintails]] with a pair of [[hair tie]]s, and [[green eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style.  She wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a yellow [[necktie]], a [[belt]], and dark brown [[thighhighs]]. When under medium damage, it is revealed she wears a [[yellow bra]] and [[side-tie panties]]. In her [[kinugasa kai ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] form she has a [[one side up]] hairstyle instead of twintails.

Her [[machinery|combat gear]] includes twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s in each hand, the left significantly taller than the right, as well as a third turret strapped to her left thigh.  Strapped to her back like a backpack is a miniature replica of the original ship's bridge, with a [[crane (machine)|]] hanging off the back.  

She is a stereotypical energetic high school girl, but like many of the energetic destroyers or cruisers, she is mostly known (if she is known at all) as [[Aoba (kancolle)|]]'s less-popular younger sister, and is generally only seen in Aoba's company.

h4. Appearance

title: kazagumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kazagumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] light [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]], and [[grey eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: hatsuzuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hatsuzuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Nakajima Megumi]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a side [[hair_flaps|flap]], [[hachimaki]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[black bodysuit]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on platforms, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (hatsuzuki's)|]]. 

Hatsuzuki is a "bokukko", and refers to herself with the "typically young boy" pronoun of "boku". She has a stoic, serious, and taciturn personality, similar in some respects to [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]], however she has a far more selfless and humble personality. This is likely due to all her service escorting, and her final mission in Leyte Gulf ending in a "last stand" sacrifice so the survivors of [i]Zuikaku[/i] could escape.

title: washington_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[personification]] of the USS [i]Washington[/i] (BB-56). Character design by [[Zeco]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with an [[ahoge]] as well as [[grey eyes]] and [[headgear]] jutting out from the sides of her head. 

Her default outfit is a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]] under a [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]] that exposes her [[bare shoulders]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]] with shin guards. Her [[rigging]] includes her famed nine 16-inch (406 mm)/45-caliber Mark 6 guns, plus additional 12.7 cm twin gun mounts at kai form.

She is usually depicted with [[South Dakota (kancolle)|]], oftentimes at odds with each other, a reflection of the rivalry the crews of the two historical battleships had. The rivalry stems from ill feelings by [i]South Dakota[/i]'s crew who mistakenly thought they were bait for [i]Washington[/i]'s attack in the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal where she severely damaged and sank [[Kirishima (Kancolle)|]] and [[Ayanami (Kancolle)|]].

title: akizuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akizuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with a [[hachimaki]] and tied to a [[ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white socks]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life fire control director as a ponytail tie, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan]]. She also carries four spare 10cm barrels in a [[thigh strap]] holster on her right leg, referencing the 10cm Type 98 gun's short barrel life requiring frequent barrel replacement.

She appears somewhat older than most of the other destroyers, having a significantly larger displacement compared to the earlier models as historically, her class was meant for anti-air duties and needed a larger hull for more anti-air guns.

h4. Skins

* !post #3228244: Base art
* !post #2470733: [[Akizuki (yukata mode) (kancolle)|Yukata]]
* !post #2987849: [[Akizuki (swimsuit) (kancolle)|Swimsuit]] (unreleased)

h4. Personality
Akizuki's hourly lines reflect how, owing to being a later-war destroyer, her crew typically had to suffer through having a shortage of rations, where meat was rarely served.  As a result, there are often jokes of her being in awe of being served even "ordinary food,":/posts/1945272 and having her "mind blown by something luxurious.":/posts/2054386 (pool #10990)

She has been nicknamed "ducky" due to alternate Kunrei-shiki (official) Japanese romanization rendering her name as [i]Akiduki[/i] instead of the Hepburn form (which Danbooru currently uses). Together, Akizuki and her sisters [[Teruzuki (kancolle)|Teruzuki]] and [[Hatsuzuki (kancolle)|Hatsuzuki]] are sometimes referred to as "the duckies".

title: kiso_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kiso[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears an [[eyepatch]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sisters Kuma and Tama, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white hat]], [[white skirt]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and funnels to her back, a 14 cm gun mount on her left, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to a [[brown belt]]. 

Bears a resemblance to [[Murasa Minamitsu]] on account of her artist having done Touhou arts prior to Kancolle.

title: isuzu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Isuzu[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue_hair|dark blue hair]] in [[twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sisters Nagara and Natori: a [[white shirt]] with a [[brown sailor collar]] and [[detached sleeves]], white [[hair bow]]s for her twintails, [[brown neckerchief]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels to her back, connecting platforms that have her 12.7 cm twin gun mounts, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, and 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]], and a [[searchlight]] and 12.7 cm twin gun mount on a [[bullpup]] stock. 

Initially infamous for her low remodeling level (12), she became valuable for farming, which can give you a radar and enhanced AA stats if used as modernization fodder.

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Umikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied in a single [[braid]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her left eye]]. Her default outfit is a modified version of the class' [[black serafuku]] with [[detached sleeves]], featuring a large white stripe on the front of the blouse, [[blue neckerchief]], [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[mary janes]]. 

She has a serious and eager personality, and tends to worry over her sister-ship, [[Kawakaze (Kancolle)|]].

For her base and kai forms, she is portrayed with a [[white bikini]], white [[detached collar]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]], and [[thigh strap]]s containing her hull [[rigging]]. title: noshiro_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Noshiro[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] in [[twin braids]], and [[blue eyes|blue]]/[[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is her class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], dark [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[asymmetrical legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, two hull pieces containing her three real-life 15.2 twin gun mounts with a [[joystick]] control, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right [[rudder footwear|rudder boot]], and her [[flight deck]] on the left boot.

body:

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit at base form is a one-piece [[black dress]] [[school uniform]], [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[mechanical halo]], and uses a [[glaive (polearm)|]] as her sidearm. 

Depicted as a foil to her sister [[Tenryuu (Kancolle)|]], she has a demure yet somewhat sadistic personality.

title: executor_(arknights)
body:
[i]Executor, a professional undertaker sent from the Laterano Embassy, is glad to fulfill any and all contracts[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Federico Giallo

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]181 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A lawyer from the Laterano Notarial Hall, he came to Rhodes Island along with [[Vermeil_(arknights)|Vermeil]] in order to fulfill his client's last wish to give Vermeil treatment for her oripathy. He himself has been contracted to Rhodes Island, where he executes functions related to the rights of Laterano citizens. His main weapon is a shotgun, most likely based on a [[Winchester Model 1887]].

Due to the way he speaks and his behavior, many of his colleagues are convinced he is just a robot disguised as a living person.

As a Sankta, his motif is an angel. He has a black halo above his head and crystallized black "wings" coming out of his back.

He is voiced by Takashi Kondou.

h4. Skins

* !post #3897769: Default
* !post #3897772: Elite II
* !post #3897774: [[executor (titleless code) (arknights)|Titleless Code]]

h4. Alternate Forms

* !post #6371634: [[executor the ex foedere (arknights)|Executor the Ex Foedere (Guard)]]
* !post #8413575: [[executor the ex foedere (allmind as one) (arknights)|Allmind as One]]
other_names: イグゼキュター(アークナイツ)

title: suzutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]]/[[grey hair]] tied [[one side up]] with a [[hachimaki]] and fire control director, and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit, the class uniform, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[grey corset]] patterned off her real-life bow, two-tone [[white gloves|white]]-[[black gloves]], [[white bodysuit]], [[grey jacket]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and knee-length [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, and two hull pieces with sentient 10 cm [[anti-aircraft gun|dual-purpose]] guns named [[Chou-10cm-hou-chan (suzutsuki's)|]]. Upon remodel her [[hachimaki]] becomes white, the writing changes from "61st Destroyer Division" to "41st Destroyer Division", and her Chou-10cm-hou-chan gains a set of 25mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2929942: Base (DesDiv61)
* !post #2929949: Kai (DesDiv41)

title: kasumi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kasumi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[side ponytail]], [[yellow_eyes|yellowish]]-[[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

She is notorious as the worst verbally abusive shipgirl. Yes, she is even more foul-mouthed than [[akebono (kancolle)|Akebono]]. She often treats her [[admiral (kancolle)|Admiral]] as a dumb servant and is constantly hardheaded and irritated. However this only hides her [[tsundere|feelings]] especially when you marry her; she gets flustered more often.


h4. Skins

title: tenryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Tenryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Ayaki]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and an [[eyepatch]] covering her left eye. Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], checkered [[black necktie]], [[black jacket]]/[[cardigan]], [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]], and [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is semi-futuristic in theme and consists of her real-life bridge to her back with two 14 cm single gun mounts, and floating [[headgear]]. 

Depicted with a tough girl personality with the catchphrase of "Heh, you scared?"; she is, however, often depicted in a way that subverts this generally because her stats are very sub-par for her ship type and is generally used as expedition fleet fodder rather than part of a combat fleet. She is also depicted as a babysitter to the destroyers due to her low fuel cost.

h4. Appearance

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z1, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

body:

title: hakos_baelz
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]], designed by [[Mika Pikazo]].

The leader of holoCouncil, she's the embodiment of chaos who manifests as a [[mouse girl|rat girl]] to signify her power.

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail|tail]] with a [[tail bow]]. Her hair is mostly [[red hair|red]] with [[streaked hair|streaks]] of [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]] and black [[colored tips]], she also has [[blue eyes]] with red highlights and [[medium breasts]] (although artists often [[alternate breast size|depict them in varying sizes]]).

Her default hairstyle is [[uneven twintails]] tied with [[dice hair ornament]]s and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

title: weedy_(arknights)
body:
[i]Weedy, a researcher in Rhodes Island's Bioengineering Department, has set foot on the battlefield after completing her studies.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]155 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A bioengineering expert who was born into a family of Iberian scientists, is a researcher who has been with Rhodes Island since its establishment. She has chosen to become an operator of her own free will, providing long-ranged support to other operators on the battlefield.

A neat-freak in nature, she regularly nags fellow engineer [[Closure (Arknights)|]] regarding her sloppy lifestyle, and collaborates with [[Glaucus (Arknights)|]] on various projects and research works. Also possesses a bionic seadragon named [[Leaf (Arknights)|]].

Uses and deploys water cannons during combat. Her motif and callsign is based from [i]Weedy[/i] seadragons.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Naganawa Maria]].

Born in Londinium in Victoria, Lava is the younger twin sister of her fellow Operator, [[Hibiscus (Arknights)|]]. After contracting Oripathy, she came to Rhodes Island for treatment. She found the idea of saving lives appealing, and so volunteered for training. Lava is tough and ignores the advice of others when she moves into action. She is gentle and childlike at heart but prefers not to admit it to herself. Whenever anyone brings this up, she immediately changes the subject and tries to play it cool.

Member of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1, along with [[Fang (Arknights)|]], [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] and her older sister, Hibiscus.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

title: hololive_english
body:
[[hololive]]'s English-language branch, launched in August 2020.

h4. List of Members

h5. hololive English -Myth- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoMyth]])
Debuted in September 2020.
* [[Ninomae Ina'nis]] "Ina"
* [[Takanashi Kiara]]
* [[Watson Amelia]] "Ame" (inactive since October 2024)
* [[Mori Calliope]] "Calli"
* [[Gawr Gura]]

h5. hololive English -Promise- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoPromise]] [i]or[/i] CouncilRyS)
Officially merged as "Promise" in August 2023, but had already been a well-known unofficial group under the "CouncilRyS" name ever since Sana's graduation.
h6. Project: HOPE Vsinger
Debuted in July 2021.
* [[IRyS (hololive)|]]

h6. hololive English -Council- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoCouncil]])
Debuted in August 2021.
* [[Tsukumo Sana]] (graduated July 2022)
* [[Ceres Fauna]] (graduated January 2025)
* [[Ouro Kronii]]
* [[Nanashi Mumei]]
* [[Hakos Baelz]] "Bae"

h5. hololive English -Advent- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoAdvent]])
Debuted in July 2023.
* [[Shiori Novella]] "Shiorin"
* [[Koseki Bijou]] "Biboo"
* [[Nerissa Ravencroft]] "Rissa"
* [[Fuwawa Abyssgard]]
* [[Mococo Abyssgard]]

h5. hololive English -Justice- ([i]a.k.a.[/i] [[holoJustice]])
Debuted in June 2024.
* [[Elizabeth Rose Bloodflame]] "Liz"/"ERB"
* [[Gigi Murin]] "GG"
* [[Raora Panthera]]
* [[Cecilia Immergreen]] "Ceci"/"CC"

h5. Other

* [[Tsukumo San]], [[Ceres Faun]], [[Ouro Krono]], [[Nanashi Muman]], and [[Hayko]] - [[Genderswap]]ped versions of Council that appeared in a stream on January 25th, 2022.

h6. Unofficial

[[Akai Haato]] is sometimes jokingly referred to as "hololive English Gen 0", due to being the most capable English speaker in hololive's original Japanese branch (after [[Kiryu Coco]], who retired in July 2021). This is exacerbated by her frequent collaboration streams with hololiveEN members, and her insistent use of the hashtag "hololiveEN" in the titles and descriptions of her videos even when she's not collaborating.

h6. Staff
* [[Omega Alpha]] - an avatar of the holoEN's staff team with unique design
* [[Enma-chan]] - the [[real life insert|real life]] manager of Ina. Received a character design created by Ina.
* [[Kumomane]] - another manager of Ina. Tweeted on her behalf during a hiatus in October 2024.
* [[Jenma-chan]] - the real life manager of Gura, Amelia, and Kiara. Received a character design created by Kiara.
* [[J-chad]] - the real life manager of Calliope. Received a character design created by Calliope.

h6.  Mascots
See [[List of hololive mascots]]

h4. See also
* [[Mythbreakers (hololive english)|]]: holoMyth's all-member [[World of Darkness]] campaign hosted by [[Mori Calliope]] with the other four girls as players.
* [[Enigmatic Recollection]]: a modded [[Minecraft]] roleplay and accompanying multimedia project, starring the full EN branch from Myth to Justice.

h4. External links

* "hololive English YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@hololiveEnglish
* "Hololive Production English Twitter: @hololive_En":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En]

title: etorofu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Etorofu[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] with [[orange hair|orange]] [[gradient_hair|gradient tips]], [[thick eyebrows]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' [[serafuku]]: a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[white gloves]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and an [[anchor]] with an ankle [[chain]].

She has an energetic, dutiful and forthright personality, similar to, but even more eager than [[Fubuki (kancolle)|]].

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Leader of Rhodes Island's Op Reserve Team A1 and a skilled spear user. She, [[Beagle (Arknights)|]], and [[Kroos (Arknights)|]] left Columbia for Rhodes Island after being infected with Oripathy and were discriminated because of their illness.

Has impulsive tendencies and appears to be somewhat envious of her teammate [[Lava (arknights)|]] because of the abilities she acquired from contacting Oripathy. Despite her shortcomings, she constantly works hard to lead her team to glory.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Shiraishi Ryouko]] (Japanese), Chen Yanyi (Chinese), Norma Butikofer (English), and Kim Ha-ru (Korean). Her art designer is [[Xiayehongming]].

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile

A somewhat polite and quiet girl, she is the Karlan Saintess and supreme leader of the entire religion in the country of Kjerag. She is also the second of the Silverash siblings, being the older sister of [[cliffheart_(arknights)|Encia "Cliffheart" Silverash]] and the younger sister of [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodas Silverash]]. How she came to Rhodes Island and her employment by them is confidential.

Despite her stature, she is quite a lazy bum and always slacking off, given any chance.

Just like her siblings, her motif is based on the snow leopard.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[hayami saori|Saori Hayami]].

title: gotoh_hitori
body:
Main character in [[Bocchi the Rock!]]. Also known by her titular nickname "Bocchi", an introverted girl with an exceptional skill at playing [[guitar]]. She struggled to find any friends due to her social anxiety until she joined the Kessoku Band at the request of [[Ijichi Nijika]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[one side up]], [[large breasts]] (according to ch. 4 of the manga)  & [[hair between eyes]] (sometimes depicted with [[hair over eyes]]). She usually wears a [[cube hair ornament]], a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[track jacket]], a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Other times depicted wearing [[pink pants|pink]] [[track pants|track]] [[pants under skirt|pants under her skirt]]. She [[playing instrument|plays]] the [[Gibson Les Paul]] [[Electric Guitar]], which she is usually depicted [[holding instrument|holding]] or keeping in [[instrument case|guitar case]].

She is voiced by [[Aoyama Yoshino]] and portrayed by [[Morino Mamo]] in the stage-play.

Not to be confused with [[Hitori Bocchi]] from [i][[Hitoribocchi no Marumaru Seikatsu]][/i].

title: saileach_(arknights)
body:
[i]Standard-bearer Saileach has come to Rhodes Island from County Hillock.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Jane "Janie" Willow

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 31[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former Victorian ceremonial standard bearer, she served at the Victorian Army Barracks in County Hillock, where the head of the local Rhodes Island branch office presented her as a liaison operator. She has basic Victorian Army training under her belt, superior physical ability, and demonstrated a talent for support operations. Peers regard her as compassionate, friendly, carries herself with due elegance, idealistic and an extraordinary cook; generally regarded by the fandom as the game's take on the [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] archetype.

Her callsign is the Irish term for her surname, [i]willow[/i]. Her [[saileach (elite ii) (arknights)|second promotion]] art depicts a [[naga]] in reference to her Sargonian lineage. Uses a [[rapier]] and a blue-and-yellow Victorian banner in battle.

One of the main characters of the story [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tomatsu Haruka]] (Japanese), Yuan Weng (Chinese), Meaghan Martin (English), and Kim Sun-hye (Korean). Her art designer is [[Xiayehongming]].

A world renowned volcanologist and catastrophe messenger from Leithanien. She is exceptionally talented in the use of advanced Originium techniques and high-energy Arts. Her Oripathy is quite severe, which has made her nearly deaf. She is currently undergoing treatment at Rhodes Island, while providing support in Catastrophe research, environmental observation/assessment, assistance in traversing dangerous terrain, among others. She is the daughter of [[Katia Naumann]] (father) and [[Magna Naumann]] (mother).

Her motif is based on sheep. Her callsign is a reference to the Icelandic volcano [i]Eyjafjallajökull[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Taneda Risa]].

title: tsushima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Tsushima[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]], voiced by [[Imamura Ayaka]] (initial) and [[Seto Asami]] (after Imamura's retirement). 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient_hair|gradient]], and [[two-tone eyes|two-tone]] [[purple eyes|purple]]-[[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Etorofu[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], [[white gloves]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, additional depth charges slung to her side, and a [[blue ribbon|blue]] ankle ribbon.

As a coastal defense ship, her class is even smaller than destroyers, and as such, she is portrayed as an "elementary school student" character, even younger than the generally "middle school" appearances of the destroyers. She comes off as having a cool personality.

The seventh member of the class, she was transferred to Taiwan post-war as ROCS [i]Lin An[/i], serving until 1963. She is named after "Tsushima Island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsushima_Island]  at the Korea Strait between South Korea and Japan. The island is also known as Daemado (대마도) as Changwon City, South Korea "lays claim to the island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_claim_to_Tsushima_Island], but not South Korea itself.

title: fusou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Fusou[/i]. Character design by [[Rikka (rikka331)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with her real-life pagoda mast as a [[hair ornament]] on her left side, and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] style comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[black sash|black]] [[obi]] with her fire control directors, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], red [[thigh strap]], [[white socks]], and [[okobo]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of her real-life 35.6 twin gun mounts arrayed two per side, and additional fire control directors on her [[knee pads]]. 

As she is very much an image of the classical Japanese beauty (in particular the geisha or shrine maidens of Kyoto), she is also given the "京美人戦艦" ("Beauty of the Capital" Battleship) tag on Pixiv.

title: mutsu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Mutsu[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of her real-life bridge wings as a [[hairband]], [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]] in the [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[red thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]], unlike her sister [[Nagato (Kancolle)|]], consists only of her four 41 cm twin gun mounts held to her waist and to a funnel on her back, plus a [[chain]] and [[anchor]] wrapped around her left leg.

She is sometimes drawn as a [[Mutsu (Snail)|snail]] due to her horn-like headgear.

Infamous for once having the lowest luck in the game (3, 6 at Kai, a more respectable 16 at Kai2), stemming from her historical demise (she suffered a magazine explosion which cut her in half while at Hashirajima fleet anchorage). Because of her fate, she is often depicted as being easily exploded with the slightest movement (sneezing, coughing, getting excited...).

body:
[[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] obtained her second remodel with the 27 February 2019 update.

She obtained a new outfit similar to [[Nagato Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Nagato]] before her, the differences (outside of color) being a v-neck instead of a [[turtleneck]] and draped half-sleeves + short gloves instead of short sleeves ending in long gloves. title: ch'en_(arknights)
body:
[i]Ch'en, Special Inspection Unit Chief, L.G.D., is cooperating with Rhodes Island to fulfill the obligations outlined in her contract[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Ch'en Hui-Chieh

h4. Profile
[expand]

The head of the Lungmen Guard Department's Special Inspection Unit. During her time with the Department, she cracked down on crime, fought violent offenders, tracked down armed fugitives, and brought down international criminals. She also works at Rhodes Island, providing on-site tactical command.

She is the primary protagonist in the story [i]Episode 5: Necessary Solution[/i].

Her motif is based on a Chinese dragon.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Ishigami Shizuka|Shizuka Ishigami]] (Japanese), Jen Zhang (Mandarin), Bao Shaoye (Cantonese), Amy Lennox (English), and Chung Yu-joung (Korean). Her original art designer is [[yui (niikyouzou)|yui]], while her [b]After the Storm[/b] outfit is drawn by [[five-fall]].

title: idw_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Parker-Hale IDW]] (Individual Defense Weapon) in [[Girls' Frontline]]. 

Due to a combination of her particularly annoying voice, her status as a common rarity weapon, and her sharing the same production time as the more desirable Grizzly MkV, she has a knack for appearing when the player least desires her, which is quite frequently.

Would receive a [[IDW (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], IDW appears as [[Betty (neural cloud)|]].

title: kitakami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kitakami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with the back in a long [[braid]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her base outfit, shared with her sister [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[green shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]] with white stripes, and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her base [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]] mount, and twin 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left arm.

Her personality goes all over the place. Sometimes, she's a genuinely nice girl; other times, "she trolls":/pools/7431 [[Abukuma (Kancolle)|]]. She often expresses her annoyance with the destroyers. She is likes to boast of her abilities, such as referring herself as "Super Kitakami-sama" after remodeling.

The nature of her relationship with [[Ooi (Kancolle)|]] varies but they are usually very close to each other. In some versions, Kitakami is straight while Ooi is a lesbian, and Kitakami has to repeatedly shred Ooi's delusions. In others, they're a romantic couple. In yet further versions, they're both bisexual and have eyes for the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] and each other.

body:
A type of large late 19th century to mid 20th century oceangoing [[warship]] characterized by its heavy armor and large guns that was ultimately rendered obsolete by advances in airplane and missile technology. 

This tag covers various types of battleship, ranging from pre-dreadnought battleships prior to [[World War I]] to modern battleships at the end of [[World War II]].

title: tan_yang_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] kai form, after being transferred to the Republic of China ([[Taiwan]]).

She wears a [[red shirt|red]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar|grey]] [[sailor collar]] and [[brown neckerchief]] over a [[white dress|white]] stylized [[china dress]]. She wears more modernized communications [[headgear]] and dual-anchor [[hairclip]]s (which are miniature versions of the ROC Navy emblem) and sports [[machinery]] which includes Type 89 12.7 cm/40 dual mounted guns as well as new Taiwanese weapons due to the ROC Navy having no access to the original Japanese armaments. Her [[rudder footwear|rudder boots]] sport the number 12, in reference to her new hull number DD-12. Noticeable immediately is that Tan Yang dresses more conservatively with a slightly longer dress compared to either Yukikaze in base form or in her official second remodel.

Her name can also be romanized as "Danyang" in Hanyu Pinyin instead of Wade-Giles. The game officially uses the Hanyu Pinyin romanization, but the Wade-Giles one is used here for historical reasons as well as the tendency for Taiwanese to shun the mainland-formulated Pinyin.

Even before she was added to the game, some fan artists had already created their own versions of Tan Yang, either through [[original remodel (kantai collection)|]]s, mere associations with Taiwan, or juxtapositions with anything vaguely Chinese in general, [[AceA4]] being one prominent example.

title: iowa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Iowa[/i] (BB-61). Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], grayish [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]] with visible [[cleavage]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey corset]] with her real-life hull number printed on it, [[blue shirt]] tied to the front, [[American flag print]] [[thighhighs]] (red vertical stripes for the right, blue for the left), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], two-tone grey-blue [[miniskirt]], [[black belt]] with the US Navy emblem, and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces containing her three historic three 406 mm/16-inch triple mounts Mk7, one to her left and two to her right. She also carries three of her ten 127 mm twin mounts: one beside the starboard main guns, two to the back of the portside main gun. Her funnel carries searchlights on either side and has two Bofors 40 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s below the searchlights. Another Bofors quad mount is atop her third main battery turret, while the second turret has three Oerlikon 20mm mounts on its top. 

Much like [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], Iowa is loud, friendly and energetic. Also like Kongou, she uses English mixed in with her Japanese speech, but her English is so broken and accented many find it incomprehensible.

Her historical counterpart is currently docked in the Port of Los Angeles complex as a museum ship, making her the first ship to appear in the game which wasn't sunk, scuttled, scrapped, or expended as a target. She is also the first Allied ship implemented in the game.

title: houston_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Houston[/i] (CL/CA-30), fifth of the [i]Northampton[/i]-class cruisers.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a stylized [[naval uniform]] with a [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap]], a [[corset]], [[detached sleeves]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black_pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[shin guards]], and [[high_heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a smokestack, a [[crane (machine)|]], and two large cannon [[ship turret|turret]]s, each having three barrels.

The historical [i]Houston[/i] was launched in 1929 and was sunk by torpedoes in the Battle of Sunda Strait, on March 1st, 1942.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Batavia Princess]].

title: kamoi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Kamoi[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Seto Asami]]. 

She is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[white_hair|white]] on the outside, [[blue_hair|blue]] on the inside and the eyebrows) and tied to a [[folded ponytail]] with a [i]matanpus[/i] [[headband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Each of her forms has her wear some variant of a blue [[cropped jacket]] over a long, [[sleeveless_dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] with [[thighhighs]]. In her base form her thighhighs are black bandages. In her [[Kamoi Kai (kancolle)|Kai]] form she wears [[thigh boots]]. In [[Kamoi Kai Bo (kancolle)|Kai Bo]] form her headband loses its pattern.

She was one of a few Japanese ships in-game to be built abroad (besides [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]]). In her case, at New York Shipbuilding Corporation, at the same time as [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]], before her conversion (for this reason, [i]she[/i] is the key for building Saratoga with LSC). However, she shows very little traces of her birthland and instead acts as the token minority of the fleet. Her design is heavily influenced by the [[Ainu]], featuring distinctive patterning as well as a [[ainu_clothes|few clothing items]] and objects. 

She is the only ship in the game to change ship class three times as well as the only ship who irreversibly (but nominally) return to their original ship class. As Kai Bo, she is the only other ship other than [[akitsushima (kancolle)|Akitsushima]] to field Flying Boats.

She is named after "Matua":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matua_(island)] ([i]Matsuwa[/i] in Japanese), one of the Kuril Islands spread between [[Hokkaido]] and Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula.

title: nagato_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Nagato[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[Japanese clothes|Japanese-style]] [[midriff]] [[white shirt]] top, [[black corset]] with a [[gold trim]], [[black_gloves|black]] [[fingerless_gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with black trim, grey waist piece with a [[kikumon]] (based off her bow), [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two connected hull pieces in a half-circle, fastened to her back with a funnel and containing her four 41 cm twin gun mounts and two 14 cm single mounts. 

Often portrayed as cool and professional if a bit prideful, being one (and the first) of the Big 7 battleships legally allowed by the Washington Naval Treaty system to mount 16-inch guns. Secretly likes cute things.

In real life, she was [[Yamamoto Isoroku]]'s flagship in the first months of the war (even gave the signal for the Pearl Harbor attack to commence from her bridge). She served as part of BatDiv1 with [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and [[Mutsu (Kancolle)|]] in the [[battle of Midway]]. After the war, she was used along with [[sakawa (kancolle)|Sakawa]], [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]] and [[saratoga (kancolle)|Saratoga]] as a target at Bikini Atoll during [[Operation Crossroads]]. She was sunk after the Baker test from a combination of damage sustained on the attack on Yokosuka and the two nuclear tests.

title: sten_gun
body:
The [b]STEN[/b] (or [b]Sten gun[/b]) was a family of blowback operated, open bolt 9×19mm [[submachine gun]]s, used by [[united kingdom|British]] and Commonwealth forces throughout [[World War II]] since 1941 and the [[Korean War]]. They were notable for having a simple design and very low production cost, making them effective insurgency [[weapon]]s for resistance groups. Sten's overall appearance resembles a metal tube with a side-mounted [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] insertion on the left side.

The acronym "STEN" originated from the names of the [[weapon]]'s chief designers - Major Reginald V. [b]S[/b]hepherd, Harold [b]T[/b]urpin and [b]En[/b]field. Sten guns were produced in several basic marks, one of the most common one is the Mk II.

title: kei_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Depicted as being visually identical to [[Aris (blue archive)|]], with the difference being the [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[pink eyes]] and, sometimes, the [[red halo]].

[spoilers]She is another personality that resides within [[Aris (blue archive)|]]' mind, and is the representation of her original programming to carry out a genocidal campaign in the name of the "Nameless Priests" who created her. She will often refer to Aris as "Princess" in reference to this role. Originally she was referred to as <Key> as the program meant to unlock Aris' nature as the Princess of the Nameless Priests, but would be given the name of "Kei" during the events of Volume F as Aris accepted her as a part of her existence.[/spoilers]

Due to her nature, fanart typically portrays her as having a more caustic or aggressive personality compared to the normally kind and curious Aris.

[spoilers] In Decagrammaton Chapter 2 "Sword of Flames" Kei has been revived and her consciousness was loaded onto a purpose-built AMAS robot produced by [[rio_(blue_archive)|Rio]]. [/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

title: marshall_d._teach
body:
One of the main antagonists of [[One Piece]], also called Blackbeard.

The captain of the Blackbeard Pirates, promoted to [[Shichibukai]] after the downfall of [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]], a title he merely used to break into [[Impel Down]] where he recruited a number of powerful level 6 prisoners.

Having consumed the Yami Yami no Mi [[Devil Fruit]] he can basically turn into a black hole and control gravity.

[spoiler]He somehow absorbed [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard's]] shock-creating Gura Gura no Mi powers after his death, becoming the first and possibly only user to possess two [[devil fruit]] powers at the same time.[/spoiler]

title: sauron
body:
One of the main antagonists in [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

He was a Maia, an [[angel]]ic being in the Legendarium, who was corrupted by [[Morgoth]] and became a Dark Lord bent on controlling the world of Middle-earth. He is the main antagonist of [[The Lord of the Rings]] trilogy and was ultimately defeated after the destruction of [[the One Ring]].

He took on many forms with many names throughout his existence:

* Mairon, his original Maia name
* Annatar, a persona he took on to deceive the Elves into forging the Rings of Power
* [[Eye of Sauron]], a symbol of Sauron

title: censored
body:
When parts of the image (typically graphic or sensitive contents such as sexual organs, gore, or offensive symbolism) are obscured, typically to comply with censorship laws.

On Danbooru, this typically encompasses various Japanese pornographic materials that were censored as a result of the Japanese law. Techniques that prevent viewing sexual parts, usually [[pussy|vaginas]], [[penis]]es and [[dildo]]s but occasionally [[nipples]]. Note that the [[anus]] is not usually considered a sexual part in Japanese censorship.  

Common forms include [[mosaic censoring|mosaics]], [[bar censor|black bars]], [[blur censor|blurs]], mysterious [[light censor|white lights]], inverted colors, shaded bars, and the infamous [[invisible penis]]. [[Tentacles]] or phallic objects are commonly used to resemble genitals and generally don't need to be censored, though the point of intercourse with a vagina does. 

For obstructions that are [i]internal[/i] to the picture, like a lock of [[hair_censor|hair]] that just happens to cover the genitals, use the tag [[convenient censoring]] instead of censored.

h4. Types of censorship

* [[bar censor]]
* [[blank censor]]
* [[blur censor]]

title: chemise
body:
A chemise is essentially a [[camisole|camisole]] that ends past the waist. Usually worn as an undergarment.

In modern usage, a chemise is generally a woman's garment that vaguely resembles the older shirts but is typically more delicate, and usually provocative. Most commonly the term refers to a loose-fitting, sleeveless undergarment or type of [[lingerie]] which is unfitted at the waist. It can also refer to a short, sleeveless dress that hangs straight from the shoulders and fits loosely at the waist. A chemise typically does not have any buttons or other fasteners and is put on by either dropping it over the head or stepping into it and lifting it up. Its usually on the plainer side, being worn under clothes to smoothe the silhouette. 

As lingerie, a chemise is similar to a [[babydoll]], which is also a short, loose-fitting, sleeveless garment. Typically, though, babydolls are more loose-fitting at the hips and are generally designed to more resemble a young girl's [[nightgown]], although many modern styles have added various sexualizing features. Babydolls also have an [[empire waist]], which chemises do not. 

h4. Examples

* !post #1502701
* !post #6550712

h4. See also

* [[Babydoll]]
* [[Camisole]]
* [[Lingerie]]
* [[Nightgown]]

title: callie_(splatoon)
body:
[[splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]] character. Named [b]Aori[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[inkling]].

She is part of an [[idol]] group known as Squid Sisters (Sea O'Colors in the Japanese version) with the other member being her [[cousins|cousin]], [[Marie (splatoon)|]]. She and Marie are also both news program hostesses that announce in-game news.

She wears a purple and black-themed outfit matching Marie's and [[sushi]] [[food on head|on her head]]. Other features of this default costume & appearance include [[bow-shaped hair]] and a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]]. In general she is usually depicted with a [[mole under eye|mole under her eye]], [[thick eyebrows]] and [[star-shaped pupils]].

Her canonical [[list of weapons in splatoon|weapon]] class of choice are Rollers.

Her Japanese name comes from the Japanese word for the "bigfin reef squid":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigfin_reef_squid (障泥烏賊/アオリイカ [i]Aori-ika[/i]) and their band's name in Japanese is a portmanteau of "shiokara" (a Japanese food made out of various marine animals, commonly squid) and "colors". Callie and Marie's names in English are a play on the word calamari.

h4. See also
* [[callie_(squid_sisters_outfit)_(splatoon)|Squid Sisters Outfit]] - Callie in her most iconic stage outfit. A black and pink, strapless romper that ends in a heart-shaped neckline and puffy shorts.
* [[callie_(agent_1/casual)_(splatoon)|Agent 1]] - The pink, casual outfit that Callie wears while undercover as [i]Agent 1[/i].
* [[callie_(young)_(splatoon)|Young Callie]] - Callie in her childhood.
* [[callie_(squid_form)_(splatoon)|Squid form]] - Callie in her swim-form.
* [[callie_(hero_suit)_(splatoon)|Hero Suit]] - Callie wearing the same safety vest as [[agent_3_(splatoon)|Agent 3]] does during the single-player campaign.
* [[callie_(airhead)_(splatoon)|Airhead]] - Callie in an orange version of her [[callie_(squid_sisters_outfit)_(splatoon)|Squid Sisters ensemble]] while also wearing a set of [[groucho_glasses|groucho glasses]] (along with several [[party_horn|party horns]], as seen from when she represented [b][i]Team Airhead[/i][/b] in the [[splatoon_1|Splatoon 1]] splatfest: [b][i]Airhead Vs Wisecracker[/i][/b].
* [[callie_(santa_costume)_(splatoon)|Santa Costume]] - Callie in a red Santa-esque variant of of her Squid Sisters outfit.
* [[callie_(fancy_party)_(splatoon)|Fancy Party]] - Callie wearing a fancy black and cyan dress from when she represented [b][i]Team Fancy Party[/b][/i] in the [[splatoon_1|Splatoon 1]] splatfest: [b][i]Fancy Party Vs Costume Party[/b][/i].

* [[callie_(octo_idol_outfit)_(splatoon)|Octo Callie]] - A rebellious inversion of Callie’s [[callie_(squid_sisters_outfit)_(splatoon)|Squid Sisters ensemble]], worn by her [spoilers]as she’s being [[mind_control|mind controlled]] by a pair of [[hypnoshades_(splatoon)|hypnoshades]][/spoilers] in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2’s]] single-player campaign.
** [[callie_(octoling_armor)_(splatoon)|Octoling armor]] - Callie in a set of [i]Octoling armor[/i]. Commonly a remnant of the pre-release period of [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]], before fan-artists knew what her full design was going to look like, as they only had and ominous silhouette of her to go on.
** [[callie_(unused_coat_outfit)_(splatoon)|Unused fur coat]] - An unused design for Callie's octo outfit. Most prominently features a large, pink fur coat.
** [[callie_(unused_octo_idol_outfit)_(splatoon)|Unused octo idol outfit]] - Another unused design for Octo Callie. This one featuring an outfit similar to that of a cheerleader, with spiraling eyes and an unidentified splatling weapon.
* [[callie_(kimono)_(splatoon)|Kimono]] - Callie wearing a kimono similar to the one [[marie_(splatoon)|Marie]] has in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]] but in her own colors. Usually featured in role-swap artwork.
** [[marie_(octo_idol_outfit)_(splatoon)|Octo Marie]] - Callie's cousin, [[marie_(splatoon)|Marie]], in her own fan-interpreted version of the Octo Idol outfit. Popularly features a gas mask instead of the hypnoshades, and is commonly featured in role-swap artwork as an opposite to the kimono appearance.

* [[callie_(alterna)_(splatoon)|Alterna]] - Callie in the outfit she wears during the single-player campaign of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
* [[callie_(splatoween)_(splatoon)|Splatoween]] - An orange, black and green version of Callie’s Squid Sisters outfit (also features red eyes and [[stitched_face|stitched]]  [[face_paint|face paint]]), which she wears in [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] during the special seasonal splatfest in fall.
* [[callie_(frostyfest)_(splatoon)|FrostyFest]] - An white and gray version of Callie’s Squid Sisters outfit (also features a [[white_scarf|white scarf]] and [[long_sleeves|long sleeves]]), which she wears in [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] during the special seasonal splatfest in winter.
* [[callie_(springfest)_(splatoon)|SpringFest]] - A [[striped_pantyhose|striped]] pink and cyan version of Callie’s Squid Sisters outfit (also features a broken [[easter_egg|easter egg]] as headwear), which she wears in [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] during the special seasonal splatfest in spring.
* [[callie_(summer_nights)_(splatoon)|Summer Nights]] - A light-colored, fruity outfit that Callie wears in [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] during the special seasonal splatfest in summer.
* [[callie_(news_anchor)_(splatoon)|News Anchor]] - A unique black suit that Callie wears in a promotional image for the map-rework of the Hammerhead Bridge stage in [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
* [[callie_(grand_festival)_(splatoon)|Grand Festival]] - A unique white dress with spiky accessories that Callie wears during the extra special Grand Festival of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].

* [[callie_(sporty)_(splatoon)|Sporty]] - A fan-designed outfit made up of a red [[visor_cap|visor cap]], [[tank_top|tank top]], [[shorts]] and [[sneakers]]. The design was first created by [[colo_(nagrolaz)|ColoDraws]] and later popularized by the public release of a 3D model based on it by [[wo262]] and [[mandala_furikake|Mandala Furikake]].

title: to_be_continued
body:
Phrase included when a written or drawn work is incomplete and will be continued in the next illustration or comic. Also included at the end of a TV episode when a story had to be cut short due to time constraints, usually at a cliffhanger situation.

Gained [[meme|memetic fame]] when [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]] used the text within an arrow (together with giving the final frame [[sepia]] tones) to end most episodes (typically on a cliffhanger) of the anime adaptations with, together with "the opening riff":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPCLFtxpadE&t=40s of the song "[[Roundabout (song)|]]" by [[Yes (band)|]] as the first season's ending.

A similar memetic format is used in [i]The Eric Andre Show[/i] at the end of its segments where the scene freezes abruptly with the text "We'll Be Right Back", alongside the song "Oregon Spirit" by Rolf Kruger.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23040127: The Famous JJBA "To be continued"

h4. See Also

title: cocktail_dress
body:
A [[dress]] suitable at semi-[[formal clothes]] occasions, sometimes called cocktail parties.

Cocktail dresses emphasize practicality. They are traditionally meant for cocktail parties, but can also be worn at bars, clubs and parties in a modern setting. Because of the practicality emphasis they are [[short dress|short]] to [[medium dress|medium]] length. If the dress is mid-calf to full-length concider using [[evening gown]] instead.

H4. Examples

* !post #7665042
* !post #7165168

** [[Tag group:Dress]]

* "Wikipedia: Cocktail dress":[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocktail_dress]

title: homewrecker_(tf2)
body:
The Homewrecker is a large two-handed sledgehammer used by [[pyro_(tf2)|The Pyro]]. 
While the term 'Homewrecker' is a given to a person or object being accused for stress on a marriage or relationship, the [[team_fortress_2|TF2]] variant is notable for its double damage stats against buildings in the game.

title: ambassador_(tf2)
body:
The Ambassador is a large frame stylized [[revolver]] for [[spy_(tf2)|The Spy]] made of 3.6 kilograms of steel.
It comes with a rosewood grip and an engraving of a reclining woman with a leotard on its barrel.

title: cara_dune
body: Cara Dune is a character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, appearing in the first two seasons of the Disney+ television series [[The Mandalorian]].

title: diamondback
body:
The Diamondback is a futuristic revolver for [[spy_(tf2)|The Spy]]. It's a promotional item in [[team_fortress_2|TF2]] referencing a weapon with the same name in [[deus_ex:_human_revolution|Deus Ex: Human Revolution]]
Its comes with black grip, front sight and cylinder with small orange details features.

title: evening_gown
body:
An evening gown is a long flowing women's [[dress]] usually worn to a [[formal clothes]] affair. It ranges from mid-calf to full-length, but never above the knees. Evening gowns are often made of a luxury fabric such as chiffon, velvet, satin, or silk. 

If the dress is knee-length of above concider [[cocktail dress]] instead. Evening gowns are formal wear, so they tend to not be extremely revealing, in such cases cocktail dress may be a better tag.

title: megalodontia_(splatoon)
body:
Megalodontia is the biggest King [[Salmonid]] that appears in Xtrawaves of [[salmon_run_(splatoon)|salmon run]] in [[splatoon 3|Splatoon 3]]. (Humorously described as "1.4 Boats wide")

It shares similarities with [[maws_(splatoon)|Maws]]. It has [[bulging_eyes|bulging]] [[blank_eyes|white eyes]] and a pair of pants held with suspenders. It also has a tuft of [[blue_hair|blue hair]] and a contraption around its jaws resembling orthodontic [[braces]]. It's back is covered in various fishing nets as well as a red hump.

title: phlogistinator
body: The Phlogistinator (also Phlog for short) is a retrofuturistic primary weapon for the [[team_fortress_2|TF2]] [[pyro_(tf2)|Pyro]]. It is shaped like a blunderbuss with silver and copper metal parts and a canister attached to it. It fires waves of energy that functions similarly to a flamethrower.

title: sopralto
body:
Sopralto also known as Moru Onpu is a female American/Vietnamese Independent VTuber who streams on Twitch.

h4. Profile

Sopralto (a.k.a. Soppy) is an average guinea pig by day and a [[magical girl]] by night. Originally, she was just a humble class pet, but one night she wished to be able to communicate with her beloved classroom children. The next day she woke up from her sleep to see she was no longer just a guinea pig, but now a guinea pig girl. She now spends her days eating the lettuce her students give her and vows to do whatever it takes to keep them happy. Being introduced to streaming by one of the kids, she now streams in her free time to fuel her lettuce addiction.

h4. External links

title: heavy_gundam
body:
A fictional giant manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]FA-78-2 Heavy Gundam[/b]

The evolution of the [[Heavy Full Armor Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], it had much beefier armor built into the unit as opposed to added on top, more powerful thrusters, which remedied the FA-78-1's horrid maneuverability, and omitted the Core Block System for more armor. It also received a new weapon system, the Frame Launcher, which mounted a huge Gatling gun and missile launchers. The shoulder launched rocket launcher of the FA Gundam was replaced with a much more powerful beam cannon.

title: rick_dom
body:
[b]MS-09R Rick Dom[/b]

A [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

The Rick Dom is a variant of the MS-09B [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] made for [[space]] combat. It retains its parent design's tough armor and cross-shaped visor, while integrating multiple added [[thrusters]] in its redesigned legs for excellent mobility in space.

h4. See also
* [[Rick Dias]]

title: black_speech_(language)
body: One of the languages constructed by J. R. R. Tolkien for his [[Tolkien's legendarium|legendarium]]. Itself a constructed langauage in-universe, it was created by [[Sauron]] to serve as the language of his forces in [[Mordor]]. Tolkien seldom wrote about the Black Speech, and it is best known for being the language inscribed on the [[The One Ring|One Ring]], written in a stylized [[Tengwar text|Tengwar]] script.

title: zakrello
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime series from 1979. 

[b]MA-04X Zakrello[/b]
 
One of the earliest [[mobile armor]]s fielded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during The One Year War, the Zakrellos straight-line speed was tremendous buts its agility suffered due to lack of verniers. It was armed with a scattering mega-particle gun, twin heat "Nata" weapons for close combat, and 4-tube missile launchers.

title: zeta_gundam
body:
[b][i]Zeta Gundam[/i][/b] is the [[mecha]] anime 1985 TV sequel to [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. It was created by largely the same creative staff as is predecessor, but veteran designer [[Ookawara Kunio]] was assisted in mechanical designs by newcomers [[Nagano Mamoru]] and [[Fujita Kazumi]]. It also had character designs by [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]] and [[Yasuhiko Yoshikazu]]. 

[i]Zeta Gundam[/i] followed in the footsteps of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (1982) by including a large number of transforming [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[robot]]s, a first for a [[Gundam]] show.

It is set in the year [b]Universal Century 0087[/b], eight years after the original series. It follows the story of [[Kamille Bidan]], designer and pilot of the [[Zeta Gundam (Mobile Suit)|MSZ-006 Zeta Gundam]], in an interplanetary conflict known as "The Gryps War", between the oppresive and brutal [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]] against the alliance of the valiant [[AEUG]] and the Karaba resistance organization.

The story of the series continues directly into [[Gundam ZZ]].

To this day is considered by many anime critics as the most influential and best Universal Century Gundam series ever made."(1)":https://www.fandomspot.com/best-gundam-anime/ "(2)":https://screenrant.com/best-gundam-anime-of-all-time/

title: dakimakura_(medium)
body:
A dakimakura (抱き枕) is a Japanese [[body pillow]] printed with anime characters, usually as a [[full body|full-length portrait]], [[lying]] on [[bed sheet|bed sheets]], and frequently in a state of [[undressing|undress]] or nightwear.

Many dakimakura are two-sided, showing the character clothed on one side and [[nude]] (or less clothed) on the other. These dakimakura should be tagged [[multiple views]] and not [[solo]].

Use this tag for images featuring dakimakura designs, such as post #900422.  When a dakimakura is included as an object in the picture, use [[dakimakura (object)]] instead.

Use [[double dakimakura (medium)|]] for dakis that have two characters in them.

title: gawr_gura_(school_uniform)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Gawr Gura]].

It's a [[school uniform]], consisting of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with a [[sailor collar]] and a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] or [[white socks]] and [[white shoes|]] [[print shoes|print]] [[uwabaki]]. She also has an optional [[yellow vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]] and a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[white sleeves|white]] [[cross-laced sleeves|cross-laced]] [[raglan sleeves]].

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[white hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] done in a [[one side up]] decorated with a [[rabbit hair ornament|rabbit-shaped]] [[hairclip]].
* [[Medium hair|Medium]] white hair with [[twin braids]].
* Medium white hair with twin braids with her [[forehead]] visible.

title: nymph_(arknights)
body:
[i]The young Djall Nymph goes on an adventure for the first time.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

A compassionate Kazdelian citizen with mental Originium Arts, who recently joined the Field Operations Department through Rhodes Island's Kazdel office.

She has an older sister who work as a director of Rhodes Island's HR department.

She made a playable debut in the Story Collection event [i]A Kazdelian Rescue[/i], one of the main characters in the Integrated Strategies [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables.[/i]

Her voice actress are [[Sekine Hitomi]] (JP), Cai Na (CN), Anna Devlin (EN), and Lee Yu-ri (KR). Her illustrator is [[yuji_(fantasia)|YUJI]]

title: tequila_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator Tequila, all smiles on the battlefield too.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: Ernesto Salas

The son of Bolívarian militant [[Pancho Salas (arknights)|]], and [[La Pluma (arknights)|]]'s brother. The former director of the International Trade Management Department of Dossoles.

After the incident in Dossoles City, he joined Rhodes Island under the recommendation of [[Ch'en (arknights)|]].

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i].

His motif is based on the golden retriever.

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]] (Japanese), Zhengwu Wenjie (Chinese), and Kim Sin-woo (Korean). His art designer is [[Kang Yiqian (self cultivation)|]].

title: maruyama_hiroshi
body:
A Japanese illustrator, and character designer, particularly in [[tokusatsu]] and anime.

He originally worked for [[Tsuburaya Productions]], as he did most of the character designs for the [[Ultra Series]], mainly in the Heisei era, from [[Ultraman Tiga|Tiga]] to [[Ultraman Mebius|Mebius]].

After stepping down as the main character designer for the Ultra Series, as well as departing from the company, he then did the creature designs for the [[Battle Spirits]] franchise, as well as the character designs of the [[Phantom (Kamen Rider Wizard)|Phantoms]] from [[Kamen Rider Wizard (series)|]].

title: bodystocking
body:
A bodystocking is similar to a bodysuit, but usually made of sheer material or soft fabric, while a [[bodysuit]] is more rigid and thick.
Think of it as a full-body [[pantyhose]].

[[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]], [[Ganyu (Genshin Impact)|]] and [[Isolated Island Oni]] are examples of characters who wear bodystockings.

h4. See also

* [[lingerie]]
* [[bodysuit]]
* [[unitard]]

title: sagiri_(swimsuit)_(kancolle)
body:
The [[swimsuit]] [[official alternate costume]] of [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Sagiri (kancolle)|]]. 

She wears a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[frilled_swimsuit|frilled]] [[casual_one-piece_swimsuit|casual one-piece]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg swimsuit]] with a [[criss-cross halter]], [[side-tie_swimsuit|tied on the sides]] and held with small [[anchor]]s, initially under a frilled turtleneck side-tie shirt which disappears in Kai form. Optional are a [[white choker]], a [[hairband]] [[hair_flower|adorned with white flowers]], a pair of [[earrings]] apparently shaped like [[lemon slice]]s, a long [[white shawl]], and [[sandals]]. The apparent skimpiness of the swimsuit, especially the Kai form, has in some way provided a minor popularity boost to one of the more forgotten Ayanami sisters.

Also became a [[sagiri_(kancolle)_(cosplay)|popular cosplay item]] upon implementation, thus giving it the [i]rei no mizugi[/i] (例の水着; i.e. "[i]that[/i] swimsuit") tag.

h4. Appearance
* !post #5507429: Base
* !post #5505179: Kai

title: trucy_wright
body:
The 15-year old adopted daughter of [[Phoenix Wright]], and works as [[Apollo Justice]]'s co-counsel. She is a magician with numerous tricks at her disposal. [spoiler]Her real parents are [[Zak Gramarye]] and [[Lamiroir (ace attorney)|Thalassa Gramarye]].[/spoiler]

Trucy has [[low-tied long hair|low tied long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and an [[antenna hair|antenna]] that often appears [[short hair|short]] when viewed from the front and [[blue eyes]]. 

Trucy's [[magician]] outfit consists of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[top hat]], a [[single earring|single]] golden [[diamond earrings|diamond]] [[earrings|earring]], a [[red scarf]] on her neck, a [[blue cape|blue]] [[cape]] with a [[green gemstone]] [[brooch]] and a [[print cape|print]] consisting of card suits - [[spade (shape)|spades]], [[heart]]s, [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]] and [[club (shape)|clubs]], a [[short dress|short]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[black dress|black]] [[dress]] with [[diamond button|diamond]] [[buttons]], a [[belt pouch]], a pair of [[white gloves]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Naruhodou Minuki

title: ema_skye
body:
A detective and forensics "expert" despite not passing her forensics exams. [[Phoenix Wright]] helped her out in a past case, so she repays the favor by helping [[Apollo Justice]] and [[Trucy Wright]] in their cases. Skye loves snacks, and gets annoyed easily. Her snack of choice is [[karintou]] (localized as snackoos).

She has [[green eyes|green]]/[[aqua eyes|aqua]] eyes and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. When she was 16, she had it tied into a [[topknot]], but as she got older, she switched to a [[half updo]], instead.

Her outfits vary game-by-game, but all of them share a pair of [[white-framed eyewear|white-framed]]-and-[[pink-tinted eyewear|pink]] glasses [[eyewear on head|on her head]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]], a [[white coat|white]] [[open coat|open]] [[coat]] with [[lapels]] and [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up sleeves]], a [[wristwatch]], a [[shoulder bag]] of sorts, and at least one [[button badge]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]], when she was 16, she wore a [[red bowtie|red]] [[bowtie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]], a [[pink bag|pink]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a pair of [[red socks|red]] [[kneehighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[loafers]].

In [[Ace Attorney Investigations]], when she was 18, she wore a [[pink headwear|pink]] [[cabbie hat]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[striped necktie|striped]] [[necktie]], a [[blue vest|blue]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[black bag|black]] [[shoulder bag]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown shorts|brown]] [[shorts]], and a pair of [[black thighhighs|black]][[two-tone thighhighs|-and-]][[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|under]] a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced footwear|lace]][[lace-up boots|-up]] [[boots]].

In [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]], when she was 25, she wore a [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]], a [[green vest|green]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], a [[red bag|red]] [[shoulder bag]] with [[vial]]s inside, a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[brown pants|brown]] [[capri pants|capri]] [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

In [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]], when she was 27, she mostly reprised her outfit from AJ:AA, except she also wore a [[red armband|red]]/[[brown armband]] [[armband]] with a [[text print|text]] [[print armband]] noting her position in the police force.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8845946: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845967: [[Ace Attorney Investigations]]
* !post #8845955: [[Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney]]
* !post #8845969: [[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice]]


[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Houzuki Akane (宝月茜 / ほうづき あかね)
