title: z1_leberecht_maass_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the German destroyer Z1 [i]Leberecht Maass[/i]. Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sister Z3, consists of a dark [[blue hat|blue]] [[sailor hat]] with her name on it, a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue sailor collar|sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], dark [[blue socks]], and [[ankle boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast to her back, connecting two hull pieces that have her 12.8 cm single gun mounts and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], as well as a third 12.8 cm twin [[handgun]] mount.

She is often depicted as a [[otoko no ko]] in fanart due to her somewhat masculine voice and mannerisms along with her [[androgynous]] looks.

title: tanikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i], the fourteenth ship of the Kagerou-class destroyers.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[white hairband|white]] [[hairband]]. Like her division mates from the 17th Destroyer Division, she wears a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] and blue button-up [[serafuku]] with a yellow scarf (similar to [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]) on top of a Kagerou-class standard [[pleated skirt]] along with [[white thighhighs]]. On her back is her [[rigging]], with an attached [[depth charge]]. Like most of the Kagerou-class, she wears [[white gloves]]. She [[dual wielding|dual wields]] two [[handgun]]s, one resembling the standard 12.7 cm twin gun, the other resembling an anti-air gun.

She speaks like a stereotypical [[Edoben|Edokko]] despite being built in Osaka. Thus, she is the opposite of [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]] (who speaks in [[Kansaiben]] but was built in Yokohama, just nearby Tokyo). Also, because of her accent, she has a good relationship with [[Suzukaze (kancolle)|]] who shares the same accent, and is sometimes shown sprouting [[Buront]]isms.

She is a frequent victim of [[breast envy]] due the fact that she is only one in 17th Destroyers Division who has a [[flat chest]] and is often compared with her sisters and division mates [[Urakaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hamakaze (kancolle)|]] who have [[large breasts]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24758453: Base
* !asset #24758483: [[Tanikaze D Kai (Kancolle)|D Kai]]
* !asset #24758456: [[Tanikaze (christmas) (kancolle)|Christmas]]

* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer [i]Tanikaze[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Tanikaze_(1940)

body:
A sort of trend that started in 2024, where allowing your girlfriend/boyfriend/whatever to [[biting ear|bite your ear]] may bring good luck. It also apparently applies to artists drawing the act.

May depict the act of [[biting ear]] or [[imminent bite|imminent biting]].

It may have started with "this tweet":https://twitter.com/kannkannna/status/1731996672807600503 of [[Kan Kanna]] and [[Tsukine Kona]] (asset #24838068). post #7159043 may be the first instance of this phenomenon drawn.

title: unicron
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] franchise.

[b]Unicron[/b] is an evil, all powerful, massive and sentient [[alien]] [[robot]] that transforms into a yellow and silver metallic [[planet]]. He is a god of evil, neither [[Autobot]] nor [[Decepticon]]. He is in a constant struggle against his benevolent brother [[Primus (transformers)|]]

Motto: [i]"That which does not become a part of the one... shall become one with the void!!!...".[/i]

h4.See also

* TFWiki: "Unicron":http://tfwiki.net/wiki/Unicron

title: steven_armstrong
body:
[b]Senator Steven Armstrong[/b] is the main antagonist of [i][[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]][/i].

An independent US Senator and presidential hopeful from Colorado, [spoiler]Armstrong runs World Marshall and is responsible for triggering the series of events of the game.[/spoiler] Before then, he had attended the University of Texas before joining the US Navy, though the details of his service record are unknown. His ultimate goal is to start a war between the US and Pakistan [spoiler]and use it as a means to win the Presidential elections and turn America into a Ultra-individualistic Social Darwinist state.[/spoiler]

His bombastic personality and raw physical prowess (having fought [[raiden_(metal_gear)|Raiden]] to a standstill) has lent itself to a number of notable [[meme]]s, most famously concerning the fact that he was [[nanomachines_son!_(meme)|at some point injected with nanomachines]] that harden in response to physical trauma.

h4. See also
* [[Raiden punching Armstrong (meme)]]
* [[Nanomachines son! (meme)]]
other_names: スティーヴン・アームストロング
スティーブン・アームストロング

title: raiden_punching_armstrong_(meme)
body:
A [[quick time event]] from the 2013 video game [i][[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]][/i] in which the protagonist [[Raiden (metal_gear)|]] [[rapid_punches|rapidly punches]] the main villain [[steven_armstrong|Senator Steven Armstrong]] in the stomach to no effect.

The scene, often combined from the song "It Has to Be This Way":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N72U-NFu44k (better known by its first lyric "Standing Here I Realize") from the game's soundtrack, has been used as source material for image macros, video captions, GIF captions and remakes. Note that the song doesn't play in this part but rather the final phase in actual gameplay.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Raiden Punching Armstrong / Standing Here I Realize":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/raiden-punching-armstrong-standing-here-i-realize

h4. See also

* [[nanomachines son! (meme)]]

title: vergil_status_(meme)
body:
Recurring [[meme]] where [[Vergil (Devil May Cry)|]] from [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] interrupts (usually sensitive) content with Judgment Cut End while an unofficial edit of "Bury the Light" (more specifically the a capella "I am the storm that is approaching" chorus) plays in the background.

The meme itself an offshoot of a previous meme called "Revengeance Status" where the same sensitive content is also interrupted, but this time with a character from [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]] (typically [[Steven Armstrong|Senator Armstrong]], Monsoon, or [[Samuel Rodrigues|Jetstream Sam]]).

title: devil_may_cry_(series)
body:
[b]Devil May Cry[/b] is a series of five hack and slash video games. The series was developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Kamiya Hideki.

Originally intended to be a sequel in Capcom's [[Resident Evil]] series, Devil May Cry was such a radical departure from the series' style that it was developed into a new property entirely. The series is set in a modern world, and centers on main character [[Dante (devil may cry)|Dante's]] goal of avenging his mother's murder by exterminating demons.

The gameplay consists of heavy combat scenes in which the player must attempt to extend long chains of attacks while avoiding damage in order to exhibit stylized combat; this element along with time and amount of items collected and used are taken under consideration when grading the player's performance.

title: yamato_(sword)
body: [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]]'s trademark dark-forged blade appearing in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. It is a legendary sword that was once wielded by his father [[Sparda]], and was left to Vergil as a keepsake. It resembles a Japanese [[katana|Ōkatana]] and is imbued with tremendous magic, being able to cut through anything.

title: laundry_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 2
[b]Attribute:[/b] Water
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can send the top 3 cards of your Deck to the GY. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Laundry Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1600

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Her dragon form is [[Dragonmaid Nudyarl]]. Can be easily distinguished by her blue/purple [[wa maid]] uniform.

As the youngest-looking member of the archetype (as well as her artwork), she is depicted as being childish and clumsy. She is also occasionally paired with [[Eldlich the Golden Lord]] in fanart due to a series of fanarts by [[Hatano Kiyoshi]] referring to her supposed synergy in Eldlich decks. She is also often paired with [[Parlor Dragonmaid]], who is often depicted as her "sister figure".

In fanart, Laundry Dragonmaid also has a rivalry with [[Tearlaments Merrli]] because both of them has the same "mill 3" effects that also synergizes with Tearlaments decks, albeit Laundry is deemed inferior due to her lacking built-in fusion ability that Merrli has. This trend in rivalry fanart shot up when Merlli got banned in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]].

body:
Cone-shaped [[hair bun]]s. This includes both [[double bun]]s and [[single hair bun]]s.

Be careful not to confuse with [[hair horns]], [[hairpods]] (cone-shaped [[bun cover]]s), [[animal ears]], or the [[beehive hairdo]]. If a character's hair is tied so tightly that they resemble sharp horns ([[Mioda Ibuki]]), or their hair sticks up to form natural spikes ([[Marnie (pokemon)|]]), use [[hair horns]].

title: house_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 9
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Dragon monster
Once per turn, during the Standby Phase: You can target 1 other "Dragonmaid" monster you control; Special Summon 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY in Defense Position, whose Level is 1 higher or 1 lower than it. When another face-up Dragon monster(s) you control returns to your hand (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy it.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]], a member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] in her dragon form. As indicated from her title, she is the Dragonmaid archetype's head maid.

Although House Dragonmaid has Light attribute, her maid uniform color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color, this may due to her being inspired from a [[Victorian maid]].

House Dragonmaid is often depicted having a serious personality, she can get angry for [[Parlor Dragonmaid]] eating sweet sneakily or [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] doesn't have her laundry job done.

h4. See also

* [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] (dragon form)

title: musashi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Musashi[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Misato (voice actor)|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in [[two side up]] style and [[twintails]], [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]], [[dark skin]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of chest [[bandages]] in a [[sarashi]] style, [[black cape|black]] [[capelet]] with a [[red sailor collar]], [[kikumon]] collar, [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. The only visible difference in her [[Musashi Kai (Kancolle)|kai form]] is that her red skirt and jacket/capelet turn black.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces in a half-circle and held by a funnel to her back, containing her three 46 cm triple gun mounts and four 15.5 cm triple gun mounts (base) or two 15.5 plus six 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts (kai); [[thigh strap]]s with armor-piercing shells, and a headpiece based off her real-life rangefinder.

title: morgoth
body: In [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], [b]Morgoth[/b], meaning "Black Foe" or "Dark Enemy", was the name that the Elves gave to Melkor, the divine spirit that rebelled against the god Eru Iluvatar and became the original source of evil in the world. After his defeat, his role as Dark Lord was taken over by his trusted servant [[Sauron]].

title: vergil_(devil_may_cry)
body:
[b]The Alpha and the Omega, Vergil[/b]

Vergil is the older of the twin sons of [[Sparda]] and [[Eva (Devil May Cry)|]], and is the main antagonist of [[Devil May Cry 3]]. 
Unlike [[Dante (devil_may_cry)|]], his younger brother, he embraces his demonic heritage and despises his human one. His personality is a complete opposite to Dante's; whereas Dante is hot-headed and sarcastic, Vergil is cold-blooded and sardonic. He has a lust for power and is willing to disregard anything to obtain the power of his father, Sparda, a trait that stemmed from their mother's death, and his helplessness back then. 

When his lust for power didn't get in the way, he will at times ally with Dante, to the point of using Dante's guns, a weapon he personally despises.

He uses [[Yamato (sword)|]], a keepsake from his father, and possesses a sense of style which rivals Dante's. 

After being decimated in the story as Nelo Angelo, he is said to have been survived by his son, [[Nero (devil_may_cry)|]].

Voiced by Daniel Southworth.

h4. See Also
* [[Vergil's Chair (meme)|]]
* [[Vergil Status (meme)|]]

body:
[[Marie Rose]]'s skin for [i]Vacation Lane[/i], [[Azur Lane]]'s collaboration with [[Dead or Alive Xtreme|Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation]].

It utilizes her Cymric [[one-piece swimsuit]], which first appeared as her second costume in [[Dead or Alive 5|Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate]] and then in [i]Dead or Alive Xtreme 3[/i], where it was given its name.

It consists of a [[blue one-piece swimsuit|blue]] [[frilled swimsuit|frilled]] [[highleg one-piece swimsuit|highleg]] [[one-piece swimsuit]] with a [[red bow]]. The fighting costume version adds [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], and [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[blue thighhighs]].

title: changchun_(warship_girls_r)
body:
The personification of the Chinese guided missile destroyer [i]Changchun[/i] in [[Warship Girls R]]. She is the modified form of [[Reshitelny (warship girls r)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]], and wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]], [[white thighhighs]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] with a [[red star]] [[star hat ornament|ornament]]. Her alternate costume "The One and Only" is the same, but with a [[white dress]] sailor dress and short [[blue socks]]. Her [[machinery|ship parts]] include a [[thigh strap]] on her right leg with a gun turret mounted on it, and uniquely for Warship Girls R ship girls she has a pair of [[missile launcher]]s.

title: diamond_clan_outfit
body:
The outfit worn by members of the Diamond Clan in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]][/i].

It consists of a [[blue hoodie]] with a [[Dialga]]-themed hood, over what appears to be a [[black kimono|black]] and [[blue kimono|blue]] [[two-tone kimono]], and a [[brown bag]]. The hoodie has the Clan's emblem on its chest. The male outfit has [[brown pants|brown]] or [[grey pants]] while the female one has [[aqua leggings|aqua]] and [[blue leggings|blue]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[leggings]]. The outfit also has [[black boots|black]] and [[red boots|red]] [[boots]], which are longer in the male outfit.

While generic NPCs wear the same clothes, wardens wear variations of this outfit, mostly with some accessory, or pants or leggings with a different color.

title: dice
body:
[b]Dice[/b] are small, throwable objects used to generate random values in various forms of gambling and a wide variety of games.

While six-sided, [[cube|cubical]] dice are by far the most common, [[polyhedral dice]] with [[d4_(die)|4]], [[d8_(die)|8]], [[d10_(die)|10]], [[d12_(die)|12]], and [[d20_(die)|20]] sides appear frequently in specific settings, particularly in table-top [[Dungeons & Dragons]] and its many descendants.

Although the singular form is [b]die[/b], use this tag regardless of how many dice are actually present in the picture.

h4. See also

* [[dice hair ornament]]: When dice are worn as accessories on the head (other than earrings).
* [[dice earrings]]: When dice are worn as earrings.

title: ultraman_tiga
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]]. His human host is [[Madoka Daigo]]. He is notable for being the first Ultraman in the franchise to be able to change forms, as well as being the first Ultra to appear in a televised series since [[Ultraman 80]], ending a 15-year semi-hiatus.

His name "Tiga" is the Malaysian/Indonesian word for "three", which is fitting, considering Tiga has three forms.

h4. Forms

title: maikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Maikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[parted bangs]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is the Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform: a black [[vest]] over a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress_shirt|dress shirt]], [[white gloves]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Each class member has a different color for their neckwear, hers is a [[red bowtie]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back with 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount, a second 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on [[thigh strap]]s. 

Her name means "whirlwind", but when read literally it means "Dancing Wind", so as a joke and primary character trait, she's treated as a character who loves [[dancing]]. She is constantly excited and upbeat, often talks about wanting to dance with the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], refers to combat as a 'dance' as well, and says she dislikes gloomy things.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1741647: Base
* !post #3410000: [[Maikaze (valentine) (kancolle)|Valentine]]
* !post #3244948: [[Maikaze (yukata mode) (kancolle)|Yukata]]

title: mejiro_ardan_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. The Mejiro from the Oguri Cap era (She first appeared in the Cinderella Gray manga). Just like McQueen, she has an ojou-like personality although she is friendly and gentle. Just like her real life counterpart, she also has weak and fragile legs to the point that she is dubbed the "Lady of Glass". Voiced by [[Aizawa Saya]].

title: icosahedron
body:
A geometric shape composed of 20 faces, all of them triangles.

h4. See also

* [[d20 (die)]]

title: dodecahedron
body:
A polyhedron with twelve [[pentagon_(shape)|pentagonal]] faces. This tag is used primarily for the regular dodecahedron, one of the five Platonic solids.

h4. See also

* [[d12 (die)]]
* [[small stellated dodecahedron]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dodecahedron":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dodecahedron

title: octahedron
body:
A three-dimensional shape having eight plane faces. Basically a [[diamond (shape)|diamond shape]] depicted in 3D.

h4.See also

* [[d8 (die)]]
* [[Stellated octahedron]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: tetrahedron
body:
A [[polyhedron]] composed of four [[triangle|triangular]] faces. If all four faces are equilateral triangles, the tetrahedron is regular. Also known as a triangular [[pyramid (geometry)|]].

A compound of two regular tetrahedra is called a [[stellated octahedron]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20875379

h4. See also

* [[d4 (die)]]

h4. External links

* "George Hart: Virtual polyhedra compounds":http://www.georgehart.com/virtual-polyhedra/compounds-info.html
* "Wikipedia: Tetrahedron":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetrahedron
* "Wolfram MathWorld: Regular Tetrahedron":https://mathworld.wolfram.com/RegularTetrahedron.html

title: tetsujin_28-gou_(2004)
body: A 2004 anime adaptation of the [[Tetsujin 28-gou]] series, directed by Imagawa Yasuhiro and notably featuring a [[retro artstyle]] inspired by the [[tetsujin 28-gou (classic)|original manga and anime]].

title: tetsujin_28-gou
body:
A 1956-1966 [[mecha]] manga series by [[Yokoyama Mitsuteru]]. It has been adapted into several media franchises. 

It is notable for being one of the first [[super robot]] anime series ever made.

h4. Works

* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (classic)|]] (1963-1966), first anime series, also known as [i]GIGANTOR[/i] in America.
* [[Taiyou no Shisha Tetsujin 28-gou]] (1980-1981), second anime series.
* Chou-dendou Robo: [[Tetsujin 28-gou FX]] (1992~1993)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou (2004)]], fourth series, adaptation of original manga and anime set in 50s-60s.
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Hakuchuu no Zangetsu]] (2007 anime film)
* [[Tetsujin 28-gou Gao!]] (2013-2016)

h4. Characters

* [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]]
* [[Professor Shikishima]] (His first names varied depending on titles)
* [[Professor Furanken]]
* [[Cross Association]] ([i]Juuji Kessha[/i]) members
* [[Tetsujin 28]] (mecha)
* [[Black Ox]]
* [[Monster (tetsujin 28-gou)|]] 

h4. See also

* [[shota]] - the slang word "shotacon" was taken from [[Kaneda Shoutarou (tetsujin 28-gou)|]], main protagonist of this series

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tetsujin 28-go":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsujin_28-go

title: tetsujin_28-gou_(classic)
body:
The original manga and anime of the [[Tetsujin 28-gou]] series, first published from 1956 to 1966, while the anime ran from 1963 to 1966. It would later go on to serve as the primary inspiration for the [[tetsujin 28-gou (2004)|2004 anime series]].

This iteration of Tetsujin was aired in America under the localized title [b]Gigantor[/b], which dubbed 52 of the original 97 episodes.
other_names: 鉄人28号(テレビアニメ第1作)

title: super_robot
body:
[b]Super Robot[/b] (スーパーロボット [i]Sūpā Robotto[/i]) is an old genre of anime focused on giant [[robot]] [[mecha]] with various super powers, special and flashy weapons, and the cliche of attack/special move naming.

It originated from [[Tetsujin 28-Gou]] from the [[1950s_(style)|]]/[[1960s_(style)|]] and the [[Mazinger Z]] series created by [[Nagai Gou]] in the early [[1970s_(style)|]]. While not as popular as it was during its beginnings, it still continues to this day.

It evolved into the more realistic [b]"Real Robot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mecha_anime_and_manga#Real_robot [/b](リアルロボット [i]Riaru Robotto[/i]) anime genre started by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]'s [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] in the late [[1970s_(Style)|70s]] and early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. This genre also continues to this day.

title: super_robot_wars_x-omega
body:
A [[Super Robot Wars]] mobile game launched in 2015. Due to it's nature as a gacha game, it constantly added new series for events and promotions, and quickly amassed the largest roster in the franchise. Character designs for the game's new original characters are provided by [[Watanabe Wataru (character designer)|]].

Following a sudden announcement on the official Twitter page, the game was shut down on March 30, 2021.

title: shogun_warriors
body:
Shogun Warriors was a short-lived [[Marvel]] comic series featuring licensed Japanese [[super robot]]s as part of the Marvel superhero universe. The comic series focused on three robots in particular - [[Raideen (mecha)|]] (renamed Raydeen), [[Combattler V (robot)|]] (renamed Combattra), and [[Danguard Ace]] (renamed Dangard Ace). The three robots were piloted by new original characters and the combiners were changed from multi-pilot units to single-pilot.

The comic series was an extension of Mattel's late 70s/early 80s toyline of the same name, which featured imported Japanese [[mecha]] toys from assorted anime  and [[tokusatsu]] series, as well as some [[kaiju]]. Apart from the robots listed above and some [[Super Sentai]] toys, the following were featured exclusively in the toyline.

* [[One-Seven]] from [[Daitetsujin 17]] (renamed to 17 Robot)
* [[Daimos]] from [[Toushou Daimos]] (renamed to Dynamo, as in the Starbirds dub)
* [[Getter Dragon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Dragun, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Getter Liger]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Raiden)
* [[Getter Poseidon]] from [[Getter Robo G]] (renamed to Poseidon, as in the Starvengers dub)
* [[Gaiking (dmg)|]] from [[Gaiking]]
* [[Grendizer]] from [[UFO Robo Grendizer]] (someties called Grandizer)
* [[Great Mazinger (robot)|]] from [[Great Mazinger]] (sometimes called Great Mazinger or simply Mazinga)
* [[Leopardon]] from [[Spider-Man (toei)|]] (with no references to Spider-Man himself made on the product)
* [[Voltes V (mecha)|]] from [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]]
* [[Getter-1]] from [[Getter Robo (classic)|]] (sold as a [[model kit]] only)
* [[Godzilla]]
* [[Rodan]]

title: getter_robo_(classic)
body:
The original [[Getter Robo]] manga and anime series, created by [[Ishikawa Ken (illustrated)|]] and [[Nagai Gou (artist)|]]. Both the anime and manga premiered in April 1974 and ran until August 1975. 

Despite running alongside each other, the manga and anime are vastly different. The anime features a more family friendly episodic format, while the manga tells a continuous story and features more graphic violence.

title: cookie_(touhou)
body:
[b]Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss[/b], or [b]Cookie☆[/b] for short, is a [[Touhou]] voice drama that was uploaded on Valentine's Day 2010 featuring eight amateur voice actresses and over twenty artists.

The video received heavy criticism for being very boring and voiced by actresses who didn't really know Touhou, before receiving more hate after news broke of what Cookie☆'s creator [[Hazuna Rio]] did. The video's tags were vandalized and it attracted the [[Manatsu no Yo no Inmu]] fanbase who actually appreciated the cheesy storytelling and bad voice acting, resulting in Cookie☆ becoming a spin-off or even separate entity from Touhou. The drama resulted in the both accidental and intentional doxxing of all of the voice actresses and the creator.

A few months later, three other voice dramas popularly known together as "Cookie☆☆" were organized by [[Taisa (Cookie)|Taisa]] and picked up by Cookie☆ fans who remade these videos in [[mikumikudance|MMD]], with these voice actresses also getting doxxed. As Cookie☆'s popularity grew, many more voice dramas were made but this wiki only includes ones noteworthy enough to get fan art. 

Due to connections with the Inmu fanbase, fans typically refer to a character by an initialism of their name (e.g. Reu -> RU, Uzuki -> UDK, etc.) with either "Aniki" (兄貴, lit. "Big Brother") or "Aneki" (姉貴, lit. "Big Sister") attached to them at the end,  corresponding to the voice actor's gender. This is called "[[Tadano Kazuhito|TDN]] Notation" (TDN表記).

h4.Characters

h6. Original Cast ("Marisa and Alice's Cookie Kiss":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHIYAaJ7CKg]) by [[Hazuna Rio]]

title: kisaragi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kisaragi[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hair ribbon]], and [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[brown eyes]] which depend on the artist. She and her sister [[Mutsuki (Kancolle)|]] wear a white version of the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[green sailor collar]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast on her back, a 12 cm single [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

In the third episode of the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] she sinks, leading to a surge of fanart shortly after that episode. See pool #9670. This is reflective of the real-life [i]Kisaragi[/i] being sunk in the battle of Wake Island in December 1941.

title: murakumo_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Murakumo[/i]. Character design by [[Ayaki]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[tress ribbon|red tress ribbons]] on her [[sidelocks]], [[orange eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Unlike the rest of the [i]Fubuki[/i]-class, she wears a short one-piece [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]], [[red necktie]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[loafers]] that double as [[rudder footwear]], and floating [[headgear]] over the sides of her head. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge as a backpack, two 12.7 cm twin gun mounts attached to it, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] mounted to her left wrist. She uses a [[spear]] as a melee weapon. She has a [[tsundere]] personality but is more open and less spiteful from the get-go than [[Akebono (kancolle)|]] and [[Kasumi (kancolle)|]]. h4. title: kamikaze_pilot
body:
[b]Kamikaze[/b] (神風, lit. "divine wind" or "spirit wind") [[pilot]]s, officially known as the [b]Shinpuu Tokubetsu Kougekitai[/b] (神風特別攻撃隊, "Divine Wind Special Attack Unit"), were a part of the Japanese Special Attack Units of [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[military]] aviators who flew suicide attacks for the Empire of Japan against Allied naval vessels in the closing stages of the Pacific campaign of [[World War II]]. 

They were first deployed during the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]. Their main purpose was to destroy warships more effectively than with conventional air attacks by crashing their explosive filled aircraft directly into the enemy ships. About 3,800 kamikaze pilots died during the war, and more than 7,000 U.S. naval personnel were killed by kamikaze attacks.

h4.See also

* [[Kaiten (weapon)|]]
* [[MXY-7 Ohka]]
* [[The Cockpit: Sonic Boom Squadron]]

title: kaiten_(weapon)
body:
The "Kaiten" (回天, literally "heaven shaker"), was a large manned [[torpedo]] based of the infamous Type 93 "Long Lance" employed by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] for suicide attacks. It is similar to [[kamikaze pilot]]s, as both were conceptualized during the late stage of [[World War II]] in a desperate attempt to slow down Allied force's advance to the Japanese home island.

It was of questionable use and exceptionally dangerous to both those handling them and the pilots; around 200 kaiten trainees, mechanics and hosts (the kaiten were fired from other ships or submarines) were killed while attempting to employ kaitens. Meanwhile, only 3 ships were sunk by the weapon.

title: ooshio_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ooshio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[blue_hair|blue]]/[[purple_hair|purple]] hair in [[short twintails]], and [[purple eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]]. 

She is a cheerful, high-spirited girl. Her catchphrase is "Big Torpedo In A Small Body!", which is sometimes jokingly referred to as a [[sexually suggestive]] phrase.

title: reference_sheet
body:
An image depicting the details of a design. A reference sheet usually consists of [[multiple views]] of the same subject from different angles, with notes [[pointing out the details]] of the design, and sometimes with details such as clothing or accessories drawn separately for characters. The image often has the character with certain [[clothes on and off]].

For characters depicted in the same pose but in different clothing (as in post #1580637), use [[variations]].

This tag is for reference sheets of any subject. Use the [[weapon focus]] and [[vehicle focus]] tags alongside this one when appropriate.

h4. Examples

* !post #3705812

h4. See also

* [[character profile]]
* [[concept art]]
* [[clothes variants]]
* [[color guide]]
* [[equipment layout]]
* [[multiple views]]
* [[sprite sheet]]
* [[stats]]
* [[turnaround]]
* [[multiple expressions]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: anya's_mother_(spy_x_family)
body: A character from the backstory of the manga and anime [[Spy x Family]]; She was the biological mother of the main character [[Anya (spy x family)|]]. Judging by her wearing the same hospital gown as her daughter and expressing a desire to soar through the skies like a butterfly, she was likely imprisoned by the same scientists who experimented on Anya, inadvertently granting her the superpower of [[mind reading]].

title: meowth
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #052 in the National Pokédex, and a Normal type.

A cat-like [[pokemon|Pokémon]] that stands on two legs. It has light yellow fur with brown accents, and wears a [[koban_(gold)|]] coin on its head. 

The best known Meowth is the one who accompanies [[Team Rocket]] duo [[Jessie (pokemon)|]] and [[James (pokemon)|]] because of its ability to talk and converse in human speech.

h4. Official art
* !asset #24835420

Meowth evolves into [[Persian (pokemon)|]]. It has two regional variants: [[Alolan Meowth]] and [[Galarian Meowth]], as well as a [[Gigantamax]] form, [[Gigantamax Meowth]].

Prior Pokémon: [[Dugtrio]]
Next Pokémon: [[persian_(pokemon)|Persian]]

h4. See also
* [[Koonya (baby Meowth)]]

title: secret_level_(series)
body:
Secret Level is a 2024 animated anthology series created by Tim Miller for Amazon Prime. Produced by Blur Studio and Amazon MGM Studios, the series feature stand-along stories based on popular video games, both old and new including upcoming new games. The series is notable for having an A-List celebrity voice cast which includes [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] and [[Keanu Reeves]] and one episode was based on the video game [[Concord (game)|]], which was already cancelled by the time the episode was released. The 1st season aired on December 2024, with a 2nd season in the works.

h4. Games featured in Secret Level

[b]Season 1[/b]

* [[Dungeons & Dragons]]

title: quilladin
body:
[[Pokemon]] #651 in the National Pokédex, a Grass-type [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]]. 

It evolves from [[Chespin]] starting at level 16 and evolves into [[Chesnaught]] starting at level 36.  

Quilladin is a bipedal, mammalian Pokémon with some plant-like features. It is largely covered in an armor-like shell similar to that of a chestnut. The armor is green in coloration with two large spines jutting out like ears. These spines and its pointed tail have red tips, and there are banded segments on the back of the shell. The lower half of the body is brown, and it has a three-pointed patch of fur decorating the front. Quilladin's stubby limbs are brown, but the top surfaces of the arms are protected by green, banded armor. It has three white, clawed digits on its hands and two on its feet. The face is exposed and unarmored, being light brown in color. It has a small, pink nose and a pointed snout, with a three-pointed patch of [[brown fur]] extending out like hair. Brown triangles mark its cheeks. Quilladin also has wide eyes, [[buck teeth]], and usually wears a cheerful expression. 

Japanese Name: [b]Hariborg[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Chespin]]
Next Pokémon: [[Chesnaught]]

title: intrepid_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy carrier USS [i]Intrepid[/i] (CV-11). Character design by [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]], voiced by [[Kubota Hikari]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey dress]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] with an aviator's [[neck pillow]], [[blue neckerchief]] with her real-life [[camouflage]] pattern (Measure 32-D3A), [[grey socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and [[radar]] masts to her back, and her [[flight deck]] to her left. Like other US carrier shipgirls, she brandishes a firearm to "launch" her aircraft, in this case an [[M1903 Springfield]] [[rifle]] with two 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] on top. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3029966: Base
* !post #3029962: [[Intrepid Kai (kancolle)|Kai]]
* !post #8643219: [[Intrepid (new year) (kancolle)|New Year]]
* !post #3792120: [[Intrepid (mitsukoshi) (kancolle)|Mitsukoshi collab]]

Her introduction into the game on the morning (Japan time) of February 22, 2018 drew mixed reactions from Western fans with the negative side taking issue with her design which is not helped by her artist's [[shibafu_(glock23)_(style)|already notorious art style]]. Her first appearance and the negative initial reactions coincided with the temporary suspension of the game's Twitter account that day, leading some Western fans to connect the perceived rage against Intrepid's design to the suspension (which was actually for unrelated reasons). In comparison, the Japanese fanbase was much more receptive for Intrepid's design with the initial negative reactions being lukewarm.

h4. See also

* [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Intrepid[/i] (CV-11)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Intrepid_(CV-11)]
* "Intrepid Sea-Air-Space Museum website":https://www.intrepidmuseum.org/

title: creditta_(princess_connect!)

A character from [[Princess Connect!|Princess Connect! Re:Dive]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair between eyes]] & an [[ahoge]]. She wears a [[orange dress|orange]] [[fur-trimmed dress]] with a black [[fur collar]], a [[monocle]], [[necklace]], [[white gloves]], [[ring]]s, [[bracelet]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:

title: konosuba!_fantastic_days
body:
[b]KonoSuba: God's Blessing on This Wonderful World! Fantastic Days[/b] is a Japanese smartphone gaming app published by Sumzap for Android and iOS. Based on the [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|KonoSuba]] series, it was released in early 2020. Service for the game on personal computer was later commenced in early 2024.

It is a party-based battle RPG that features an original story, full voice acting, and SD character designs for regular characters such as [[Satou_Kazuma|Kazuma]], [[aqua (konosuba)|Aqua]], [[Darkness (konosuba)|Darkness]], [[Wiz (konosuba)|Wiz]], [[Megumin]], [[Yunyun (konosuba)|Yunyun]], and more.

Online service for the game ended on January 30, 2025, though an offline version was announced to be in development.
other_names: この素晴らしい世界に祝福を!ファンタスティックデイズ

title: potato_jesus_(meme)
body: A meme referencing the infamous amateur restoration of the [[Ecce Homo]] ("Behold the Man") fresco in the Sanctuary of Mercy church in Borja, Spain. The result has been liked to that of a monkey, to the point of being nicknamed Ecce Mono ("Behold the Monkey").

title: derek_muller
body: Educational [[YouTube]]r that discusses science and math topics on his channel [[Veritasium]].

title: alfonsino_(fish)
body:
A deep-sea fish belonging to the family Berycidae (order Beryciformes), known for its striking red coloration and adaptations to life in the ocean's depths.

Appearance:
* Bright red or orange-red body, silvery-pink underside, and red fins/mouth lining. This coloration acts as camouflage in deep waters where red light is absorbed.
* Large eyes with a reflective layer (tapetum lucidum) to enhance vision in low-light environments.
* Deep, laterally compressed body, forked caudal fin, and elongated pelvic/dorsal fins.

title: ishar-mla_(arknights)
body:
The sea dragon-like Leviathan named Ishar'mla, titled the "Corrupting Heart," is one of the four "Firstborn" of the Seaborn representing the power of "Migration." For millenia, He was sleeping deep within the "Mantle Ruins", an abandoned First Civilization underwater complex that Aegirians believe it was the birthplace of their civilization. It wouldn't be until 200 years ago when Maritimus, the famous anthropologist who was heading Aegir´s Fourth Mantle Ruins Expedition, made contact with Ishar'mla while exploring the ruins, awakening which led to him to be plagued by strange visions about the ancient civilization's downfall, and Ishar'mla devoring anything at His pass. He would later become a Seaborn after eating one of Ishar'mla's cubs not long after.

Ishar'mla was thought to be slain by the Abyssal Hunters during the great assault against the Leviathans as they were hiding within the ancient ruins of the abyss. However, it turns out that Ishar'mla's blood has merged with Skadi after the devastating battle and remained dormant for years. Due to its divine nature and His aggressiveness, the Sea Terrors tremble before Ishar'mla and the higher Seaborn refer to Him as their close kin.

title: miya_mareena
body:
A German, mainly streaming in English [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]].

She is a [[ghost]] [[shark girl]], with a [[see-through tail|see-through]] [[shark tail]].

For her default hairstyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]].
For her default costume, she wears a [[black jacket]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[cropped shirt]], and a [[black skirt]] worn over a [[black leotard]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] and [[black shoes]].

title: arachnophobia
body: An intense and often irrational fear of [[spider]]s and other arachnids (such as [[scorpion]]s, mites, and [[tick]]s). It is one of the most common specific phobias, affecting many people worldwide. While it’s normal for some individuals to be cautious or uneasy around spiders, arachnophobia goes beyond mild discomfort—it can cause severe anxiety, distress, and sometimes panic attacks.

title: kamen_rider_ixa
body: Kamen Rider Ixa is the second Rider to appear in [[kamen_rider_kiva_(series)|Kamen Rider Kiva]]. In contrast to the black-gray-red, vampire-like Kiva, Ixa has a black-white-blue color scheme and is patterned after a knight and a Christian cross.

title: oripathy_lesion_(arknights)
body:
A specific character design feature of [[Arknights]]. In the backstory, characters infected with "Oripathy" from exposure to the mineral [[originium (arknights)|]] eventually have originium begin to fuse with their cells; this creates "oripathy lesions" both internally and externally. These appear as black [tn](except for [[Angelina (arknights)|Angelina]] and [[ceobe (arknights)|Ceobe]] — they have blue and yellow, respectively)[/tn] originium "chips" on the body and are present in a number of the character designs for characters in the game. It is not present on all characters, however, since not every operator or character is necessarily infected (or does not yet have external lesions).

It is also a feature that many fan artists, particularly ones who are not very familiar with the property, often miss. Characters that should have oripathy lesions are often missing them in fan art and even the official art can be a little inconsistent about it ("Ifrit's Elite II":/posts/3563831 art is an infamous example).

h4. Examples
* !post #6616977: On leg
* !post #5837758: On chest
* !post #6362876: On shoulder

h4. See also

* [[infection monitor (Arknights)]]

title: palutena
body:
A major character in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. The Goddess of Light, rightful ruler of Angel Land, and patron deity to [[pit (kid icarus)|Pit]]. She is kindhearted, benevolent and cheerful, as opposed to the cruel, malevolent and cynic [[Medusa (kid icarus)|]].

Palutena serves as the leader of her army, and while she never physically aids Pit on the battlefield, she does everything in her power to support her servant from the sidelines. However, although she is demure and calm, she has a [[trolling|trollish]] side to her, constantly pulling [[prank]]s on Pit or putting him through minorly dangerous situations; nevertheless, she does care for him, to [[motherly]] levels. However, she's less lenient at punishing evil than her servant Pit, hinting to a dark side of her.

As of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], her attire is usually comprised of an elegant [[strapless dress]], with a [[chiton]] hanging from a gold [[pendant]]. Her dress has a [[side slit|slit]] on her left side, and wears a [[single thighhigh|single]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs|thighhigh]] to cover her left leg. She wears [[vambraces]] and [[armlet]]s to cover her arms, as well as [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]], the left one of which has a leg wrapping. She also wears a [[laurel crown|laurel]] [[tiara]] on her head with a set of small [[forehead jewel]]s, and [[multiple belts|two belts]] where multiple pieces of [[jewelry|gold]] dangle from. In terms of body shape, she has [[long legs|long]], shapely [[legs]] and [[thighs]], and [[medium_breasts|medium]]/[[large breasts]].

title: spiffo_(project_zomboid)
body:
An orange [[raccoon]] featured in [[Project Zomboid]].

Originally a playable character in [i]PAWS[/i], a canceled fighting game by [i]Project Zomboid[/i] developer The Indie Stone, he now serves as the [[mascot]] for Spiffo's, an in-game fast food chain, as well as for the developers themselves.

title: gunfighter_ballads_and_trail_songs
body: A 1959 country album by Marty Robbins. [i]Gunfighter Ballads[/i] contains Robbins's best-known song, "El Paso", as well as [[big iron|"Big Iron"]], which became notorious online after it appeared in [i][[Fallout: New Vegas]][/i] in 2010.

title: big_iron
body:
A country ballad by Marty Robbins, from his 1959 album [i][[Gunfighter Ballads and Trail Songs]][/i]. "Big Iron" tells the story of an unnamed Arizona Ranger who rides into the town of Agua Fria sometime between 1901 and 1909 (the years of the original Ranger organization's existence). Unnerved by his silence and the large handgun he carries (the eponymous "big iron"), the townsfolk initially take the Ranger for an outlaw, until he explains that he is hunting a notorious outlaw called Texas Red.

Long overshadowed in Robbins's canon by "El Paso" from the same album, "Big Iron" entered 21st-century meme culture through its appearance on the soundtrack of [i][[Fallout: New Vegas]][/i] in 2010.

title: ganyu_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Cryo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A half-human, half-[[qilin (mythology)|]] who serves as an emissary and secretary for the Liyue Qixing.

She has [[goat horns]], with [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. She wears a brown [[bodystocking]] along with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[cowbell]] on her [[neck bell|neck]]. She wields [[Amos' Bow (genshin impact)|]].

Due to her resemblance to a [[goat]], a common joke involves her [[lactation|producing milk]], or other characters expecting her to do so. Since one part of the main story involves [[Qiqi (genshin impact)|]] searching for a "Cocogoat", they are frequent partners for this gag.

Her name is pronounced [b]Kan'u[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]] (Japanese).

h4. Costumes 

* !post #4296018: Default
* !post #7901426: [[Ganyu (Twilight Blossom) (Genshin Impact)|Twilight Blossom]]

title: boothill_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the Galaxy Rangers. Voiced by [[Konishi Katsuyuki]] (JP) and [[Andrew Russell]] (EN). 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], [[black eyes]] with [[crosshair pupils]], and [[mechanical arms]] and [[cyborg|torso]]. His default outfit, fitting of his occupation, consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[cowboy hat]], [[bullet earrings]], [[red cape]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], [[brown belt|brown]] [[ammunition belt]], [[black pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], and a [[thigh holster]] for his [[revolver]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691450: Splash art
* !post #8768050: Sailing Towards a Second Life (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
"So, here's the thing: someone went and tinkered with my Synesthesia Beacon, so now, all you folks can hear is me and those adorable little troublemakers talkin' like this... cutie, cutie, cutie. Looky here, see?"

A cyborg cowboy drifting among the stars. Extremely optimistic and unrestrained.
He is a member of the Galaxy Rangers who swore to punish the wretched by any and all means...
His flamboyant and brash actions were all to draw the attention of the Interastral Peace Corporation — the target of his revenge.
[/expand]

title: tribe_nine
body: A Japanese multimedia franchise created by Too Kyo Games, under the direction of Kodaka Kazutaka (who also created [[Danganronpa (series)|]] under Spike Chunsoft), and Akatsuki. It consists of an anime of the same name produced by Liden Films that aired between January-March 2022, a webtoon series with the subtitle "War of Tokyo"[tn](トライブナイン/ウォー・オブ・トーキョー)[/tn] that ran between December 2022 up to sometime in 2023, and an action role-playing gacha game first announced in 2020 and to be released on February 20, 2025.

title: su_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] character. One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Bodhi[/b]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]], and [[purple eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[polo shirt]] with a white cloth piece to his left, [[black pants]], [[black footwear]], and [[black gloves]]. 

On account of his profession as a scientist, he is also portrayed with a [[lab coat]].

title: vienna_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Originally started out as a facecam streamer, she debuted her vtuber model on May 17, 2021. The model is illustrated by [[hayamafair]] and [[Live2D]] rigged by [[Brian Tsui (artist)|]].

Previously a member of [[Cloud9]] as a [[League of Legends]] content creator, she left the team after two years on February 23, 2023. She afterwards switched to [[Sonii (odyssey interactive)|]], acting as PR for Odyssey Interactive. After her internship contract ended, she came back as Vienna.

She is a [[dragon girl]] with [[blue hair]] and [[red eyes]], as well a small set of [[dragon horns]]. She has a [[dragon tail]] as well, but it is not visible in all of her appearances.

h4. Costumes

* !post #5370145: [[Vienna (vtuber) (1st costume)|Default]]

title: amagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Amagi[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[high_ponytail|high]], [[wide ponytail]], [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[maple_leaf|Japanese maple]] [[leaf hair ornament]] on her ponytail. 

At base form, she wears a [[floral print|floral pattern]] [[green kimono]] with a [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] bearing her real-life [[flight deck]] camouflage pattern, and carries her banner-rod wrapped on her back. Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces painted in green, bearing her real-life bridge and [[anti-aircraft gun]]s. When she is damaged, she slumps sideways, a reference to how she was sunk in real-life.

She has a high-strung, yet still "mature woman" personality, with a lack of confidence in her abilities and constant worry about air attacks.  Her depiction in doujin works tend to run more towards the [[Yamato Nadeshiko]] end of the spectrum, focusing upon the personality implied by her unusually ornate and formal clothing in her unremodeled state.

h4. Appearance

title: amber_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

A perky, straightforward girl, who is also the only Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Her amazing mastery of the glider has made her a three-time winner of the Gliding Champion in Mondstadt. As a rising star within the Knights of Favonius, Amber is always ready for any challenging tasks.

She has [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]], [[small_breasts|small]]/[[medium breasts]], [[brown eyes]], and fair skin. She wears a jumper-like outfit composed of dark brown leather [[shorts]], a red hoodie-like top, red [[thighhighs]], and white thigh-high [[boots]] embellished with gold linings and symbols.

Her elemental skill is [[Baron Bunny (genshin Impact)|]].

title: maiden_with_eyes_of_blue
body:
[b]Attribute[/b]: Light
[b]Level[/b]: 1
[b]Type[/b]: Spellcaster/Tuner/Effect
[b]Effect[/b]: When a card or effect is activated that targets this card (Quick Effect): You can Special Summon 1 "Blue-Eyes White Dragon" from your hand, Deck, or GY. When this card is targeted for an attack: You can negate the attack, and if you do, change the battle position of this card, then you can Special Summon 1 "Blue-Eyes White Dragon" from your hand, Deck, or GY. You can only use 1 "Maiden with Eyes of Blue" effect per turn, and only once that turn.
[b]ATK[/b]: 0 [b]DEF[/b]: 0

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]] that is largely based on the character [[Kisara (yu-gi-oh!)|]], the women who carries the spirit of the [[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]].

title: mecha_pilot_suit
body:
A bodysuit worn by [[pilot]]s of [[mecha]], or a bodysuit associated with [[science fiction]] in general.

They typically have thicker material than a [[leotard]], one or more adornments or structures, parts/patches, and associated colors, lights, etc. Arm and leg covers may be anywhere from none to full.

This tag is for the fictional mecha pilot bodysuit, for the real life jumpsuit worn by pilots, uses [[flight suit]] instead.

title: prinz_eugen_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the third [i]Admiral Hipper[/i]-class heavy cruiser in [[Kantai Collection]]. Designed by [[Shimada Fumikane]]. Voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in [[twintails]] tied with [[anchor_hair_ornament|anchor hair ornaments]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] similar to [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]]'s. Unlike the other Kriegsmarine girls in the game however, her uniform is not bottomless. Instead she wears a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt|black]] [[microskirt]]. She also wears short [[black thighighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs]] that barely reach above her knees.

In her remodel, her uniform gains a [[camouflage]] pattern, her [[skirt]] turns [[white skirt|white]], and her turrets turn blue.

h4. Skins

body:
A type of [[multicolored hair]] where the hair is abruptly colored differently at the very ends. The style is known as [i]dip dye[/i] or [i]tip dyeing[/i].

Not to be confused with [[gradient hair]], where the color change is gradual rather than sudden.

title: bangs
body: Hair that drapes forward to hang in front of the forehead. Known in British English as a [b]fringe[/b]. As it would apply to almost every post on the site, the base [[bangs]] tag is no longer used. h4. Types of bangs * !post #4382765: [[arched bangs]] - For bangs curving upward * !post #4575471: [[asymmetrical bangs]] - For bangs worn half combed back, half loose * !post #7663078: [[bangs pinned back]] - For bangs that are kept in place by a [[hairclip]] * !post #7686009: [[blunt bangs]] - For straight-cut unparted bangs * !post #7461000: [[braided bangs]] - For bangs that have been braided (see also [[braid]]) * !post #7997644: [[center-flap bangs]] - A combination of [[blunt bangs]] and [[double-parted bangs]] that results in a distinctive flap of hair * !post #5735551: [[choppy bangs]] - For bangs with thin gaps of air between them * !post #7381089: [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead * !post #7640262: [[curtained hair]] - For bangs that briefly arches upward then hangs back down while the [[parted bangs|bangs part to the side]] * !post #3043948: [[diagonal bangs]] - For bangs that are cut in an odd diagonal line * !post #7540287: [[double-parted bangs]] - For bangs that are distinctly parted in two different spots * !post #7934105: [[colored bangs]] - For bangs that are colored differently from the rest of the hair * !post #7950336: [[fanged bangs]] - For bangs with thin longer sides * !post #7986694: [[hair between eyes]] - For bangs that are found between eyes (often paired with [[crossed bangs]] or [[double-parted bangs]]) * !post #4193991: [[hair over eyes]] - For long bangs that cover the eyes * !post #4415241: [[hair over eyes]] + [[covered eyes]] - For bangs that cover the eyes [i]completely[/i] * !post #7967265: [[hair over one eye]] - For bangs that cover a single eye * !post #7989717: [[long bangs]] - For unusually long bangs that go past the eyes at least * !post #7548225: [[loosely tucked bangs]] - Uncut, very long bangs being tucked away to the side but still hangs loosely over the face * !post #200120: [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs * !post #7661261: [[short bangs]] - For bangs short enough to at least fully show the eyebrows * !post #8632542: [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side * !post #3374800: [[v-bangs]] - A variant of blunt bangs that are longer in the middle than the sides and come to a distinct point in the center, forming a "V" shape on the forehead * !post #154015: [[wispy bangs]] - For bangs with large gaps of air between them

title: nishinoya_yuu
body:
Nishinoya Yū is a character from [[Haikyuu!!]]
He is a second-year student at Karasuno High School. He serves as the libero for the school's [[volleyball]] team and is referred to by his teammates as "Karasuno's Guardian Deity" for his remarkable skills.

Nishinoya is the shortest member of the team, standing at 159.3 cm. He regularly styles his wild [[black hair]] by ruffling most of it upwards. He has [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[colored bangs]] and his eyes are [[brown eyes|brown]] and slanted.

h4. Related tags
* [[volleyball uniform]], [[spiked hair]]

title: shinsha_(tensura)
body:
Character appearing in the mobile game "That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime: Isekai Memories." 

She's considered the daughter of [[Rimuru Tempest]]. [spoiler]And she's born from the wish of [[Shuna (tensura)|Shuna]] to have a child with Rimuru.[/spoiler]

She has multiple forms. The first is her slime form, unlike Rimuru she is pink. Her second form is her human form, which is very similar to Rimuru's appearance, but her eyes are red. [spoiler]And the last form is her evolved form, now with pink hair.

She has [[yellow eyes]]; [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|inner side]], [[parted bangs]] and a [[hairclip]]; two [[mole]]s, one [[mole under eye|under her left eye]] and the other [[mole on breast|on the outer side of her right breast]], near the armpit; and [[huge breasts|huge]]/[[gigantic breasts]].

body:
Character from the series [[Pripara]].

Aroma has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. Outside of PriPara, she wears a [[pink hairband]] with [[bat wings]] [[wing hair ornament|attached to it]], a [[purple capelet]] and [[Paprika Private Academy school uniform]].

Her main PriPara costume consists of pink [[demon horns]], a [[blue hat|blue]] [[mini witch hat]] with a [[purple bow]] [[hat bow|on the side]], a [[purple dress]] with a [[pink ribbon]], a [[blue collar]], a [[blue belt]], [[layered skirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]], [[blue gloves]], a [[demon tail]], [[striped thighhighs|striped]] [[purple thighhighs]] and [[pointy footwear|pointy]] [[purple footwear|purple]] [[boots]] with a [[pink bow]] attached to them.

title: odette_mori
body:
[[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' first generation. Character design by [[3pel1]]. Also shares the same character designer with [[Nyantsume]] from the same generation, along with [[Yuri Yaneva]].

On January 24, 2025, Odette announced that she would be graduating on the same day that NEXAS shuts down after initially saying that she would keep her IP, which is on the 31st of the same month, and would be rebranding.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], [[owl ears]], a [[grey hat]] and [[pink eyes]].

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[white capelet]], a [[grey coat]], a [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[pink skirt]], [[black gloves]], a [[black bag]] with multiple [[envelope|envelopes]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black boots|black]] [[fur-trimmed boots]] with [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]].

* !asset #23285470: Profile

title: tangaroa_(housamo)
body:
The Great Creator, Tangaroa, created an island world out of his own body, drawing from his own flesh and blood to bring life to its soil, foliage, and even the surrounding sky. Slightly overprotective, he longs for the happiness of all living creatures on his island, guiding them as a father and welcoming even visitors as his own children. Though the creation of his island used up most of his original flesh, he retains form as a Staff, a Sacred Artifact comprised of his few remaining bones. Only a chosen warrior of the island tribe may possess the Staff, which imbues its wielder with Tangaroa's memories, designating the wielder an incarnation of the Great Creator, and thus, leader of the tribe.

h4.See also

* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links

* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Tangaroa":https://housamo.wiki/Tangaroa

title: avicebron_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] as the Caster of Black. A magus and philosopher, founder of the Kabbalah and creator of the school of magecraft that [[Aozaki Touko]] uses. His NP is Golem Keter Malkuth.

Caster wears a featureless [[mask]] without openings for eyes or a mouth, a full-[[bodysuit]], and a [[blue_capelet]]. Due to the mask he wore, it was impossible to tell whether he was afraid or even felt any emotion at all.

[b]True Name:[/b] Solomon ibn Gabirol
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] Miyamoto Mitsuru

h4. Costumes

* [[avicebron (apocrypha epilogue) (fate)|Apocrypha Epilogue]]

title: arsalan_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.

He is the Lion Therian labelled Guardian of the Aoyama Guild and Defender of Justice. Many of his guild members depend on him. Tokyo was not the first place he was summoned to so he is knowledgeable about the cultures and customs of many other worlds, and he used to be a king, meaning that his leadership skills are exceptional. His emerald bejeweled Decorative Sword Sacred Artifact secrets holy oil. He rubs it all over his body to engage in Turkish oil wrestling. This Sacred Artifact was once possessed of an ancient monarch and anointing one's body with its oil is a symbol of the divine right to rule."

Designed by [[kira nerisu]].

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Arsalan":https://housamo.wiki/Arsalan

title: elan_ceres
body:
One of the characters in [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]. The identity belongs to multiple people, with one real Elan and the rest serving as face-grafted stand-ins for him.

All of the Elans have tell-tale accessories. Elan no.4 wears [[tassel earrings]], Elan no.5 wears diamond-shaped earrings and [[epaulettes]], and the original Elan wears a suit and no earrings at all.

title: yu-gi-oh!
body:
[b]Yu-Gi-Oh![/b] (lit. [b]"King of Games"[/b]) is a manga series and media franchise originally created by [[Takahashi Kazuki]] primarily involving the [i][[Duel Monster]]s[/i] card game. The series made its first debut in 1996 on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]].

It spawned anime, video games, and [[Duel Monster|a real-life version of said card game]] produced by [[Konami]].

The first includes a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]]. It also sometimes includes a [[white hat|white]] [[sun hat]] and a [[Poke ball theme|Poké ball-themed]] [[duffel bag]]. The second outfit includes a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]], along with [[white footwear|white]] [[mary janes]]. She also sometimes wears a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]]. Lillie's hair is [[official alternate hairstyle|sometimes worn]] in a [[ponytail with braided base|ponytail with a braided base]]. h4. title: the_o_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

The [b]PMX-003 The O[/b] is [[Paptimus Scirocco]]'s personal [[mobile suit]]. Its colossal size and girth deceivingly hide its impressive maneuverability, courtesy of countless [[vernier thrusters]] of various sizes all over the unit. 

As if that wasn't enough, it loads a massively powerful [[beam rifle]], as well as two [[extra arms]] hidden in the front skirt that can wield beam sabers of their own and overwhelm enemy units in combat. 

For defense, it has a thick armor (which gave the MS its known size as said above) which can withstand both solid and beam weaponry[spoiler], but not [[watermelon bar]]s[/spoiler].

h4. See also
* [[Xeku Eins]] - A mass produced MS with a similar design.

title: xeku_eins
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the 1987 photo novel [[Gundam Sentinel]].

[b]RMS-141 Xeku Eins[/b]

A mass-produced general purpose heavily armed and armored [[Mobile Suit]] with a design inspired by [[the_o_(mobile_suit)|The O]], fielded by a rogue group of [[Earth Federation]] officers and former members of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] called The New Desides. The Xeku has 3 configuration types for close, mid and long distance combat.

It was designed in [[real life]] by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: ritual_baton
body:
A long and flat scepter, often made from bamboo. It originates from ancient China, where it originally served as an object to write on. It is strongly associated with ancient noblemen, [[shinto]] priests, and [[hina ningyou]].

Known as [i]shaku[/i] in Japanese and [i]hu[/i] in Chinese. 

[[enma_(mythology)|Enma]]'s [[rod of remorse]] is a variant of this ritual baton.

title: anihilate_uroboros
body:
A level boss character from the [[Strider (video game)]] arcade machine released by [[Capcom]] in 1989.

[b]Anihilate Uroboros[/b] is a massive [[robot]] monster with an elongated serpent like body and a humanoid upper section, armed with a [[hammer and sickle]] in both hands.

Its name comes from the [i]Ouroboros[/i] (or Uroborus), an ancient symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail. The name originates from within Greek language; οὐρά (oura) meaning "tail" and βόρος (boros) meaning "eating", thus "he who eats the tail".

Inspired by the [[real life]] [[Ouroboros]], a symbol that represents the perpetual cyclic renewal of life, infinity and the eternal return. It also represents the cycle of life, death and rebirth, leading to immortality (as in the [[phoenix]] myth).

title: ouroboros
body:
An ancient Eastern European symbol depicting a serpent or dragon eating its own tail. What is represents is debated and may vary from artist to artist. Common interpretation are that of eternity, cyclic nature of life and death and self destruction.

title: qubeley_mk_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]AMX-004-2/3 Qubeley Mk-II[/b]

An improved version of the [[Qubeley]] [[mobile suit]] deployed by [[Neo Zeon]]. The two units produced featured minute improvements over the original, notably two extra funnels, for a total of 12 remote weapons, and a three-pronged beam saber. The first unit produced was a purplish blue with black and pink vents, intended to be piloted by [[Elpeo Puru]]. The second was orange or red with yellow vents, and was piloted by [[Puru Two]].

h4.See also
* [[Qubeley Mass Production Type]]

title: qubeley
body:
A fictional antagonist [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985 and also appears in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-004 Qubeley[/b]

A revolutionary Newtype use [[mobile suit]] produced by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. By miniaturizing the original psycommu system from the [[Elmeth]] and perfecting the [[funnels_(gundam)|"funnel"]] remote weapons, it combines overwhelming firepower and mobility in a normal-sized MS. The formidable Qubeley served as Haman Karn's personal machine in both [[Zeta Gundam|The Gryps Conflict]] and [[Gundam ZZ|The First Neo Zeon War]], and it was regarded as a fearsome, nigh-unstoppable unit even when pitted against the almost impractically powerful [[ZZ Gundam]].

The [[Qubeley Mk II]] is a later variant, piloted by [[Elpeo Puru]] and later [[Puru Two]].

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Nagano Mamoru]].

h4.See also
* [[Qubeley Mass Production Type]]

title: qubeley_mass_production_type
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986.

[b]AMX-004G Qubeley Mass Production Type[/b]

A late mass produced variant of the [[Qubeley Mk II]] [[mobile suit]], with greatly increased funnel carrying capacity and two large back beam cannons, but reduced speed and maneuverability as a result of the added weight. 

The units were mostly piloted by the remainder of the clones of [[Elpeo Puru]], with the exception of [[Puru Two]].

title: gundam_zz
body:
[b][i]Gundam ZZ[/i][/b] is the 1986 sequel to [i][[Zeta Gundam]][/i]. It was created by a mostly new creative staff, with series creator [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] being the main returning member. The first half of [i]Gundam ZZ[/i] is infamous for being significantly more comedy-oriented than previous and subsequent [[Gundam]] series. However, the tone of the series changes and becomes more serious in the second half, concluding the story of Zeta.

ZZ is set in the year [b]Universal Century 0088[/b], beginning almost immediately after the end of [i]Zeta Gundam[/i] (and the final battle of The Gryps War). It follows the story of [[Judau Ashta]], [[pilot]] of the [[AEUG]] [[ZZ Gundam|MSZ-010 ZZ (Double Zeta) Gundam]], during [b]The First [[Neo Zeon]] War[/b], a conflict originated due to [[Haman Karn]]'s declaration of war on the now weakened [[Earth Federation]].

Gundam ZZ is notable because it is the first Gundam series where an underage group of pilots ([i]The [[Gundam Team]][/i]) operate more than two different types of Gundams. This trope would be used years later in other very popular Gundam series like [[Gundam Wing]] in the mid 90s and [[Gundam 00]] the next decade.

The story of ZZ continues in [[Char's Counterattack]].

title: rick_dias
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]RMS-099 Rick Dias[/b]

The [[AEUG]]'s first original [[space]] combat "second generation" [[mobile suit]] design, taking in traditional aspects of [[Zeon]] MSs (the [[Rick Dom]] mostly) and pioneering new solutions such as the 360 degree monitors and the ejectable head-mounted cockpit. It was developed and produced by [[Anaheim Electronics]].

A red unit was initially piloted by [[Quattro Bajeena]], which sparked the fear of [[char_aznable|The Red Comet]] of old in the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]; once the AEUG became aware of this, all subsequent Rick Dias units moved on from the old black and grey (resembling the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]]) to the new red, so as to capitalize on the psychological impact of the color. Other notable AEUG Rick Dias pilots include Quattro's loyal wingmen, [[Apolly Bay]] and [[roberto_(gundam)|Roberto]].

After [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]] some red colored [[Schuzrum Dias]] variants were used by [[Neo Zeon]] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]].

h4.Related MS development
* [[Rick Dias II]]
* [[Dijeh]]

title: ecce_homo
body:
An early 20th-century fresco of [[Jesus]] by Elías García Martínez in Borja, Zaragoza, Spain

 In August 2012 news broke about a restoration attempt by Cecilia Giménez, a woman in her 80s. BBC correspondent Christian Fraser said, "the once-dignified portrait now resembles a crayon sketch of a very hairy monkey in an ill-fitting tunic". It has now jokingly been dubbed "Ecce Mono", or "Behold the Monkey". Others have referred to it as "[[potato jesus (meme)|Potato Jesus]]".

More generally, [i]Ecce Homo[/i] is Latin for "Behold the Man", a phrase spoken by Pontius Pilate at the trial of Christ.  There are also various art works with this title other than Martínez's.

h4. External links

* [1] http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-19349921
* "Wikipedia: Ecce Homo (disambiguation)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecce_Homo_%28disambiguation%29
* "Wikipedia: Ecce Homo (Elías García Martínez)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecce_Homo_%28El%C3%ADas_Garc%C3%ADa_Mart%C3%ADnez%29

title: aeug
body:
A fictional [[military]] organization from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

The [b]Anti Earth Union Group[/b] ([i]Hanchikyū Rempō Soshiki[/i]), more commonly known by their acronym as the [b]AEUG[/b] ([i]E~ūgo[/i]), [b]AG[/b] or more correctly translated, the [b]Anti United Earth Government Group[/b], is the main protagonist faction of Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam]] and Mobile Suit [[Gundam ZZ]]. The AEUG is an anti-Federation movement which initially opposed the oppressive [spoilers]genocidal[/spoilers] tactics of the Federation's elite [[titans_(gundam)|Titans taskforce]]. It was formed by [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] and [[Zeon]] One Year War veterans mostly and was founded and commandered by [[Blex Forer]] while supplied by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. They have several large [[military]] [[spacecraft]] and [[mobile suit]]s in its ranks. The [[Argama]] is the flagship of the AEUG.

[b]Karaba[/b] was a smaller Earth based resistance organization allied with the AEUG in its fight against the Titans. The [[Dijeh]] is a notable MS produced and deployed by this faction that was used by [[amuro_ray|a legendary figure]] from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War.]]

During [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]] both the AEUG and Karaba fought against [[Neo Zeon]]. [spoilers]At the end of this conflict the remaining AEUG/Karaba forces were integrated into the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] and became the core of the famous [[char's_counterattack|Londo Bell Unit]].[/spoilers]

title: operation_ten-gou
body:
[b]Operation Ten-Go[/b] was the last major Japanese naval offensive in [[World War II]] that took place on 7 April 1945. The operation occurred during the [[Battle of Okinawa]] and was a last desperate attempt by the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] to slow down the advancement of the Allied forces into [[Japan]], which ended in a defeat as the Americans' air superiority dominated the battle, leading to the sinking of the Japanese battleship [[Yamato_(battleship)|]] as well as other ships while the American aircraft that attacked them only suffered minuscule losses.

h4. Participants 

h5. IJN

* [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] (flagship) (sunk)

body: Karla is a merchant in [[Dark Souls III]] who specializes in selling dark pyromancies, dark sorceries, and dark miracles.

title: lord_zedd
body:
One of the main antagonists for [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] and [[Power Rangers Cosmic Fury]], and one of the first Ranger-exclusive villains.

He would debut as [[Witch Bandora|Rita Repulsa]]'s superior, eventually rebanishing her as to take control of operations against the Rangers, though she would return to give him a love potion and make him her husband.

title: t-elos
body:
Antagonist from [[Xenosaga Episode III]] and the [[Super Robot Wars OG Saga Mugen no Frontier]] games. Counterpart to [[KOS-MOS]], whom T-elos was intended to replace in the story.

Unlike KOS-MOS, who is an [[android]], T-elos is a [[cyborg]].

title: kaga_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Kaga[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], [[tsurime]] [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a black [[muneate]] over a [[white kimono]] top and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], blue [[tasuki]], brown [[apron]] based on the stern end of her flight deck, with the kana "カ" inscribed on it, [[black thighhighs]], and [[platform footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is very similar to [[akagi (kancolle)|Akagi's]] (and, by extension, all of Shibafu's carriers') own gear: a traditional [[yumi (bow)|yumi bow]], a [[quiver]] with a replica of the ship's mast, her full flight deck attached as a [[shield]] on her left arm and carrier-like [[geta]]. 

She has a stoic personality. In fan works, she is often paired with [[Akagi (kancolle)|]] or [[Zuikaku (Kancolle)|]]. She is sometimes portrayed as having high body temperature or being warm to the touch, due to the fact that the [i]Kaga[/i] was a converted battleship and was prone to overheating due to poor ventilation.

The historical [i]Kaga[/i] was originally designed as a battleship before being converted into a carrier. She was scuttled after being heavily damaged at the [[Battle of Midway]] in 1942.

body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Arashio[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown_eyes|brown]] or [[yellow_eyes|yellow]] eyes. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]]. 

She is often giggling and trying to act sexy (like [[Kisaragi (Kancolle)|]]), but she looks more cute rather than sexy. 

The historical [i]Arashio[/i] was completed in December 1937 and sunk in March 1943 during the Battle of the Bismarck Sea.
